issues.title: Merged cart being saved to session
issues.body: After merging carts on login, the `CartStateRequestProcessor` saves the new cart to the session. Some nested object of the order is not serializable. This causes a problem when using Redis for session sharing between nodes. When a user visits a new node, that node cannot de-serialize the session data and the user is shown an error page.

issues.title: Problem with adding additional skus for a product with product options
issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.13-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.13-GA

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Go to demo admin
2.) Go to Catalog - Products and select a product
3.) Then from Product Options tab add a product option
4.) Go to Catalog - Product Options and select the product option you added in step 3.
5.) Then add a new allowed value to the selected product option
6.) Go back to the product selected in step 2.
7.) Then from the Product Options tab add an additional sku

**Expected results**: You can add a sku with the newly created product option value

**Actual results**: The newly created allowed value does not appear in the drop-down list for the product option.

This also happens in the current demo version.

issues.title: In admin, invalid dates produce js parsing errors but do not show an error for the user to correct
issues.body:
When entering an invalid date (e.g. 05052015) and then saving, a javascript error occurs and no validation errors are displayed.

This related to BroadleafCommerce/QA#629

Commit: https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/commit/d6c4ac8399f7e7f13ad224e8a381f441a62204db

This primarily evidences itself while exercising some specific enterprise functionality for setting the sandbox date during a site preview, but could show up as the result of any use of the SystemTime.setLocalTimeSource() API. For example:

1) Call setLocalTimeSource() to a time source with a date far in the past
2) This would cause some categories, etc... to no longer show up during the execution of that thread, since their active dates fall outside of the time source date.
3) However, there is at least one flow where this thread local value is not cleaned up, resulting in an infected thread in the container's thread pool. This can cause other requests to utilize the changed date behavior, resulting in unanticipated problems. This is especially bad in multitenant environments.
issues.title: ThreadLocal changes to SystemTime are not always being cleaned up, which can result in unexpected behavior on a site

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #1490 - Always cleanup any SystemTime thread local values at the end of the request lifecycle

issues.body:
When going through the **Payment** flow, it makes sense to do use the totals found on the order and to add line items in the `translatePaymentTransaction(...)` method.

```
    populateTotals(order, requestDTO);
    populateDefaultLineItemsAndSubtotal(order, requestDTO);
```

The issue arises when going through a **Refund** flow. In this scenario, the amount refunded could be different then the order total (i.e. only return 1 out of 4 items) causing discrepancies in the amounts submitted to the payment gateways.

We need to accommodate for both scenarios.
issues.title: Discrepancies could exist between Refund amount and Order amount

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1449 - Populate totals and line items only PaymentType.UNCONFIRMED

issues.body:
When a bundle resource is accessed for the first time, the system tries to create it.    If multiple threads are all trying to use the bundle, the threads block until the first one creates it.    

The code in `ResourceBundlingService` has a race condition that can occur when multiple threads try and create the same bundle from different `site` contexts.    This can only occur in a Multi-Tenant installation but the race condition is in core Broadleaf.
issues.title: In a multi-tenant environment where tenants share bundle resources, a 404 can be cached for bundle resources

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1448 - Bundles can return a 404 in BLC multi-tenant when multiple threads from different sites attempt to create the Bundle.

issues.body:
The metadata for an entity property can inadvertently get overridden due to similar property names. There are places in the code where a startsWith comparison is done which may not result in the proper behavior.

If a property name in an admin Entity is a substring of another property's name, then the admin annotation settings tend to spill over the longer-named property. This is due to some rudimentary comparison done with properties, involving startsWith.

The QA issue that originated this is: https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/QA/issues/656

In that same issue, another BLC issue is referred to as the same as this one:
https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/issues/591

I disagree: the root cause might be the same, but this second issue refers to the behavior of metadata overrides. This issue could be reproduced even working with to simple properties the way it's described on QA, without any overrides involved.
issues.title: Admin presentation setting spill over similarly annotated properties

commitsDetails.commitMessage: issue #656 - Add utility string function for dot-segment comparisons

issues.title: Hibernate L2 cache isn't updated when adding an item to a media map
issues.body:
Select or upload an image for `skuMedia---primary`, then save and reload the page. If an L2 cache is active, the field will appear to be unpopulated when in fact the appropriate rows are present in `SKU_MEDIA_MAP` etc. AFAICT this is because when `MediaFieldPersistenceProvider` creates a new xref it doesn't actually add it to the containing collection, so Hibernate doesn't invalidate the collection's cache entry. Additionally, it seems like this violates the contract of `FieldPersistenceProvider.populateValue`.

If an L2 cache isn't active then this behavior won't appear, because later sessions will read from `SKU_MEDIA_MAP` and get the correct entities.

issues.body:
Reproduction case is pretty easy in the heat clinic:
1. A workaround for this issue was fixed in BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite@478b2f93f6bab0c6268f4dd979c5dbd42bf6f779 where the name field was made optional. Previously the regex was failing since it required at least 1 character in that field. In order to reproduce this issue, change back the `BLC_PRODUCT_OPTION` entry to what it was before.
2. Add a Hawt like a Habanero's Shirt Men's to the cart
3. Go through checkout

You will get an error on checkout because it fails this validation. However, the ordering of the checkout workflow goes like this:
1. Validate customer max offer usage
2. Validate product options
3. Confirm and validate payments
4. Everything else

Because the exception occurs in (2), the workflow never gets to the `ValidateAndConfirmPaymentsActivity` (3). Because of that, that particular rollback handler never gets registered which means that that if a payment was applied to the order from the `PaymentGatewayAbstractController`, nothing ever modifies that payment to say "yeah this is invalid". In the `OnePageCheckoutProcessor` we are explicitly hiding the billing address form and the credit card form if all of the payments on the order are equal to the amount of the order. This case is done for gift cards; if you have all of your payments done in gift cards you don't need the credit card form or the billing address form.

Long story longer, this is what happens after the above case:

![screen shot 2015-05-07 at 2 56 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/684275/7524689/53ea16c0-f4c9-11e4-8acd-2e9600a0febd.png)

No billing address and no payment form shows up but you still need a credit card payment.

Fixes here should be backported to 3.1.
issues.title: There is a possibility for payments to still show up as valid if there is an error in the checkout workflow

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixes #1352 - Make sure that all payments are marked as invalid in the PaymentGatewayAbstractController if there was any exception on checkout or applying the payment to the order

(cherry picked from commit 2282675b9776530099eca21cd833c15fa2c18035)
Fixes #1352 - Make sure that all payments are marked as invalid in the PaymentGatewayAbstractController if there was any exception on checkout or applying the payment to the order

issues.body: I would expect that configuring a start depth and end depth of 0 would build only the current category. However this actually build the configured category as well as first-level children. Same went for a start depth of 1, end depth of 1 even though it appeared the original intention was to be 1-indexed.
issues.title: Category site map configurations incorrectly always build 2 levels deep

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1341 - Site maps will now correctly respect starting and ending depths (inclusively).

issues.title: multiship address tabbing defaults to First Name
issues.body: References BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite#166

1. Click on `Content` then `Content Items`
2. Click on `Home Page Featured Products Title`

issues.title: Exception in Admin/Change Password
issues.body:
Login in admin application (4.0.0-RC1) and click on Change Password on top right throws Exception:

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
 at org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.web.controller.AdminLoginController.changePassword(AdminLoginController.java:17

```

Steps to reproduce (4.0.0-RC1):
1. Create an Offer of type "Order Item" with a target rule.
2. Change type to "Order".
3. Save

Looks like the target rule gets removed from the persistence context but not the offer.

issues.title: Exception when editing Offer

commitsDetails.commitMessage: BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce#1336 BroadleafCommerce/QA#537 - When removing a criteria xref, make sure to also remove it from the owning entity's collection

issues.body:
When I go to /product, the page initially displays and then redirects to login. Client-side I'm not really able to debug due to the redirect wiping out the browser's logs. However, from the server's perspective this is what happens:
1. Request to /sessionTimerReset
2. Cookie is set with name sessionResetTime and path _/product_ (due to running in a root servlet context). This I managed to see before the redirect.
3. Request to /adminLogout.htm
4. Request to /login

Also somewhere in there is an auth failure from an anonymous request to /product. Maybe after the logout request?
issues.title: sessionTimer.js logs out valid session

commitsDetails.commitMessage: closes #1335 - updated sessionTimer to include a resetTimeCookiePath to handle issue for root servlet context
#1335 - updated sessionTimer.js to remove cookie on session expire and use proper path for reading cookies

issues.body: When adding an additional sku to your cart that doesn't have a sale price set, but its default sku does, the sale price is not used therefore the cart shows no discount.
issues.title: Default sku sale price isn't being used for additional skus

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1334 - Fixed a bug where default skus weren't being used when sale price was null. Removed redundant code.

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.12-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.12-GA

**Development Story**
We need to extend `org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.SkuImpl`, we also use `org.broadleafcommerce.common.presentation.AdminPresentationClass` so that we force admin to always instantiate and use our extended sku, let's call it  `ExtSkuImpl`

1.) Go to `Products`
2.) Select `Product Options`
3.) Select `Additional Skus`, `Add` button

**Expected result** : Popup appears and user has the possibility to select product option values for products options.

**Actual result** :    Popup appears but user hasn't the possibility to select product option values (although the product has COLOR and SIZE as product options set, for edit it works)

**Note** :  One solution is to extend `org.broadleafcommerce.admin.server.service.handler.SkuCustomPersistenceHandler` and to change 

`org.broadleafcommerce.admin.server.service.handler.SkuCustomPersistenceHandler#createIndividualOptionField` 
`org.broadleafcommerce.admin.server.service.handler.SkuCustomPersistenceHandler#getBlankConsolidatedOptionProperty` 
`org.broadleafcommerce.admin.server.service.handler.SkuCustomPersistenceHandler#getConsolidatedOptionProperty`
`org.broadleafcommerce.admin.server.service.handler.SkuCustomPersistenceHandler#createConsolidatedOptionField`

the problem is that all this methods are static methods, and user hasn't the possibility to change them in order to add extra `setAvailableToTypes` for `org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.dto.BasicFieldMetadata` like `ExtSkuImpl`.

One simple solution would be to make this methods `protected/public` but not `static` so we have the possibility to change them, or add an extension point.

**Note2** also filtering and sorting by `consolidatedProductOptions` and it seems normal, because it is a generate column. Suggestion, make this column as no filter and sort capable.

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.12-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.12-GA

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Admin → Content → Pages/ Content Items → tab Rules
2.) Select "Restrict to certain times?" → is equal to (in not equal to)

**Expected result** :  An empty field is listed to enter your values.
**Actual result** :  No field is listed.

On entity add, persisting properties that refer to the parent will cause the parent to be persisted. The parent may fail persistence--NOT NULL foreign key field is null, bean validation failure, etc. Then `cleanupFailedPersistenceAttempt` will try to obtain the parent entity's `id` field. If the parent entity is subclassed this will fail, because `Class.getDeclaredField` doesn't check superclasses.

What's bringing this to light is the new MediaXref scheme. As a result, it seems like entities with Media fields are going to have a very hard time giving proper validation errors unless all validation is removed from Hibernate and the DB schema, and that's not something I'm willing to do.
issues.title: BasicPersistenceModule.cleanupFailedPersistenceAttempt wrongly throws NoSuchFieldException

issues.body:
Consider this case:
1. A confirmation is sent to the payment gateway for an AUTHORIZE transaction
2. The gateway completes the actual card authorization but fails because of something else like a fraud check
3. Because the card authorization went through we need to void it

This is not a super normal use case but it can happen depending on how the external gateway is configured.

@AustinMRooke @elbertbautista BTW, #1312 introduced a bug where the payment was never actually saved after being marked as invalid; that is essentially what removing the payment from the order did. It turned out that calling `order.getPayments().remove(payment)` didn't actually remove it from Hibernate but later on when you called `orderService.save(order)` it triggered a save on the Payment which persisted the archived flag to the database. The better solution though is to mark the payment as invalid and then save it (which is what we're doing now).

issues.body:
In 4.0.0-BETA13, `BroadleafRequestFilter` extends `OncePerRequestFilter`, but `CustomerStateFilter` doesn't. On an error dispatch this means BRF doesn't run but CSF does, resulting in NPE:

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
    at org.broadleafcommerce.common.web.BroadleafRequestCustomerResolverImpl.setCustomer(BroadleafRequestCustomerResolverImpl.java:62)
    at org.broadleafcommerce.profile.web.core.CustomerState.setCustomer(CustomerState.java:57)
    at org.broadleafcommerce.profile.web.core.security.CustomerStateRequestProcessor.process(CustomerStateRequestProcessor.java:148)
    at org.broadleafcommerce.profile.web.core.security.CustomerStateFilter.doFilter(CustomerStateFilter.java:55)
```

I think as long as `CustomerStateFilter` never runs when `BroadleafRequestFilter` hasn't, that would fix this. For my purposes, neither needs to run on an error page, but it's not clear to me that this should be the general behavior else I'd send a pull request.
issues.title: NPE in CustomerStateFilter on error dispatch

#1306 and BroadleafCommerce/QA#482. Ensuring that CustomerStateFilter
extends OncePerRequestFilter.  Also, making BroadleafRequestFilter,
CustomerStateFilter, and CartStateFilter so that they can be run again
before error dispatching. This will allow them to be re-run for the
purpose of re-creating applicable state during error processing.

#1306. Removed an attempt to use thread local in addition to other
locking mechanisms as it was not well conceived and was committed by
accident.

issues.body:
When `generateSiteMap()` method of SiteMapService is called, the SiteMapGenerationResponse returned never has its siteMapFilePaths variable populated. The values in this array are required for deleting an inaccurate site map after a change has been made to the sitemap's structure (i.e. after adding or deleting a product, category, or page through the admin).

After running `generateSiteMap()` the only values populated are the `sitemapIndexedFileName`, populated by default at SiteMapGenerationResponse creation, and the hasError and errorCode variables if an error occurs during Site Map generation.

To fix this, you would need to add a check that if the `gzipSiteMapFiles` boolean variable is false, you get the Site Map File Paths from the `SiteMapBuilder` created and populated in the method. If that boolean variable is true, you need a loop that adds ".gz" to the end of all the file paths as they have been compressed into gzip files.
issues.title: SiteMapGenerationResponse.siteMapFilePaths is never populated

issues.body:
`org.springframework.security.authentication.encoding.PasswordEncoder` is deprecated in Spring Security 3.2. Its replacement, `org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder`, doesn't accept a salt parameter, viz. it exists to support bcrypt. This makes it unusable in the forgot password scenario, because running the token through bcrypt twice will produce two different hashes.

Okay, the reason for salt is that users pick terrible passwords that are easily bruted. This isn't a problem for password reset tokens because users don't pick them. Hashing with SHA-256 or another decent algorithm is sufficient.

P.S. The real problem is that Broadleaf is depending on the deprecated PasswordEncoder. The real solution would be to replace blPasswordEncoder with the new implementation. The issue I'm reporting is just the first I've run into that doesn't have a decent workaround.

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.8-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.8-GA

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Go to admin
2.) Add a search facet `S1`(display order 1) on the parent category `P`
3.) Add the same search facet `S1`(display order 1) and another search facet `S2`(display order 2) on another child category `C` with parent category `P`
4.) Go to the site to category `C`

**Expected result** :  Search facet `S1` and `S2` should appear as search facets exactly in this order (`S1`, `S2`)
**Actual result** :  The search facets appear `S2` and `S1`. The facets defined in the parent `P` categories always appear at the bottom.

**Note** In the `org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.CategoryImpl#getCumulativeSearchFacets` there is a filtering of facets done, but the `!returnFacets.contains(csf.getSearchFacet())` condition is never checked given the fact that the argument is a `org.broadleafcommerce.core.search.domain.SearchFacet` and the list contains `org.broadleafcommerce.core.search.domain.CategorySearchFacet` entities
issues.title: Search facets not being displayed in desired order

issues.body:
This can be reproduced by changing the maximum results in the admin to something really small like 5 and going to view products. There are maybe 30 or so products, but 5 of them are visible on the page with the rest taken up by padding, yielding something like this:

![screen shot 2015-02-11 at 9 13 22 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/684275/6149407/4795fb02-b1ce-11e4-8fc3-3cf46338bc55.png)

The new items are never pulled in and so the grid is stuck there in that state.

Related, if that request fires to load more records because of the scroll and still doesn't come back with enough records, then you're still in a similar state with the padding problems. What should happen is that subsequent loads happen to load enough records so that they are all visible. Since this is something that is really controlled on the server-side, the frontend should make a best effort to load these subsequent requests as needed.

Also related to this, record counts were not being updated correctly on load.
issues.title: Pagination does not work if more items are available but only some are visible

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#1261, #1260, BroadleafCommerce/QA#266 - Fix various problems present in pagination for list grids:
- Make sure that table footers across the board are correctly updated on load
- Move the grid sizing to go after adding padding and scrollbar initialization so that loading more records can happen when a page is loaded if necessary
- If a list grid is the only thing on a page, it should grow to consume the whole page even if it is not a 'main' list grid type
- If server-side pagination is really small, fire off additional AJAX requests to load more records if padding is still being shown because the server did not give enough records
#1261 - Fix an off-by-one error in calculated the number of loaded rows

#1261 - Fix pagination cases when the page size coming back from the server is smaller than the max height of the grid. Before, this incorrectly showed grey padding for that case and you were never able to load the remaining pages from the server

issues.body: What should be happening is that they are expanded to fill all of the available space of the window. This is only happening on grids of type `main`.
issues.title: Non-main grids (like multi-select grids) are not sized correctly when they are the only thing on the page

issues.title: Images not being returned for a product
issues.body:
I'm having trouble getting images back for a product:
1. I add a media item (image file) to a product via the admin screen
2. The media item shows up on the admin Media tab
3. I can hit the image url in the browser directly and it returns the image
4. When I call `product.getMedia()` on the same product, it returns an empty map.

Stepping into `getMedia()`, after a couple steps it calls `SkuImpl.getSkuMediaXref()`.  In the debugger I can see `skuMedia` has the media image in it, but then the `skuMedia.isEmpty()` returns true, because of the logic in `WorkflowPersistentMap.isEmpty()`.  Idk.  Maybe a wild goose chase.

Also, it appears that in our DB, when we add images, the `BLC_MEDIA` table gets 2 new rows.  1 row has `ARCHIVE` set to `Y` and this is the row that `BLC_SKU_MEDIA_MAP` appears to be referencing via `MEDIA_ID`.  I thought that this might be part of the problem.

This was a regression from quite a while ago. Basically, we never actually saved the fact that we already published the logged in event after seeing the `UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken` and thus the event gets published on every authenticated request instead of just right after the user logged in.

issues.body:
When using the endpoint "/cart/{categoryId}/{productId}/{skuId}: POST" with the query parameter "?customerId=100", I'm getting a 404 and the following on the console:

```
[artifact:mvn] [ WARN] 12:58:52 CartStateRequestProcessor - No customer was found on the current request, no cart will be added to the current request. Ensure that the blCustomerStateFilter occurs prior to the blCartStateFilter
```

It's possible that there's something wrong with the workflow as the message suggests, or it's possible that the docs are wrong. They say "NOTE: The customer ID must be passed on each request. It can be passed on a query parameter or a request header. But it must be keyed by customerId."

In BroadleafLoginController.processResetPassword, the password reset fields are first checked for errors by the validator, then customerService.resetPasswordUsingToken is called, which returns its own set of errors. However, when deciding whether or not to stay on the form page, the validator's error response is never even considered.
issues.title: Reset Password validator being ignored

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1230 Validator for password reset form was not being used

issues.body:
Currently, we delete the index on the reindex core in `SolrIndexServiceImpl` _after_ the index has finished. The process looks like this:
1. Are we in single core mode? If so, delete the index (deletes off of the primary core)
2. Rebuild the entire index (primary if single-core, reindex if dual-core)
3. Swap active cores (only does anything if in dual-core mode)
4. Are we in dual-core mode? If so, delete the reindex core

Thus, on the next reindex presumably the reindex core is empty.

However, if there is some exception or problem with (2), the reindex core never gets deleted. You can end up in a situation where you have a reindex core halfway built, and then when you go to reindex the assumption that the reindex core is empty is false.

What should happen is that we should not wait to clear out the reindex core until the end and instead we should clear it out at the beginning of the reindex process. The new process will look like:
1. Delete the reindex core (this deletes the primary if in single-core mode)
2. Rebuild the entire index (primary if single-core, reindex if dual-core)
3. Swap active cores
issues.title: Don't assume that the reindex core is empty when rebuilding the Solr index

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1229 - Continue to invoke the old Solr document deletion method in case someone has overridden it
Fixes #1229 - Ensure that the reindex core is cleared prior to starting a reindex (as opposed to afterwards) and update docs around Solr

issues.title: Solr syntax error when filtering by price range

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #1224 - Remove unnecessary parentheses that was causing faceting by price to fail with frange and also update some general code style

issues.body:
The methods are both in CatalogEndpoint:

``` java
public SearchResultsWrapper findSearchResultsByCategoryAndQuery(HttpServletRequest request,
            Long categoryId,
            String q,
            Integer pageSize,
            Integer page)
...
    public SearchResultsWrapper findSearchResultsByQuery(HttpServletRequest request,
            String q,
            Integer pageSize,
            Integer page)
```

In both of these cases, the pageSize and page parameters are ignored. They should be apart of the `SearchCriteria` that is passed to `searchService.findSearchResultsByQuery()`.
issues.title: Searching for products in the REST APIs by Category and/or query ignores the page and pageSize parameters

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #1222 - Use the API endpoint parameters for page and pageSize in the search criteria when searching for products

issues.body: Reference is AuthenticationFailureHandler
issues.title: AdminCsrfFilter has a hard reference to a concrete class that makes it impossible to override

issues.body:
Found issue while searching for Orders in IE 8. 

The following code in `listGrid-filter.js` under `broadleaf-open-admin-platform`  does not extract the value in the Search form field : 

``` javascript
var search = $(this).closest('form').find('input').val();
```

This leads to the issue where clicking on Search button under Orders in Admin does not work in IE 8.
issues.title: Order Search in Admin fails for IE 8

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1219 Added check to see if redactor was successfully loaded to avoid 'undefined' error

issues.body:
1. Add a parentCategory to a product
2. Re-index the catalog

The product will appear first in the category, when in fact, it should be last.
issues.title: Solr indexing should first honor explicitly defined ordering for products under a category, followed by unordered products

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1212 - Make solr indexing honor null displayOrder values last during category-product ordering

#1212 - Make solr indexing honor null displayOrder values last during category-product ordering
(cherry picked from commit 6e83a32)

issues.body: We are no longer using the JDBC User Details Manager.  Instead, we implemented AdminUserDetailsServiceImpl that returns some default roles (that are not in the DB) and returns an instance of AdminUserDetails.  Since this is the case, the implementation of the BroadleafActiveDirectoryUserDetailsMapper no longer works.  We need a similar class that is added to the open admin platform that deals properly with AdminRole and AdminPermission objects.
issues.title: BroadleafActiveDirectoryUserDetailsMapper no longer works with the Admin Security Model.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#1211. Created a class that allows mapping of LDAP credentials to
AdminUser, AdminRole, and AdminPermission domain.

issues.body:
When converting th:src to blc:src I have noticed that it duplicates the context path.

E.g. `@{/img1.jpg}` becomes `/service-shop/service-shop/img1.jpg` instead of `/service-shop/img1.jpg`.

It is first added in [UrlRewriteProcessor:93](https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/blob/764f5d48700af0f19eed73b5c79a33533ecc03e1/admin/broadleaf-contentmanagement-module/src/main/java/org/broadleafcommerce/cms/web/processor/UrlRewriteProcessor.java#L93) when evaluating `@{}` and again in [StaticAssetPathServiceImpl:169](https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/blob/764f5d48700af0f19eed73b5c79a33533ecc03e1/common/src/main/java/org/broadleafcommerce/common/file/service/StaticAssetPathServiceImpl.java#L169).

We found an issue with the 3.1.10-GA version of Broadleaf Commerce Framework. We used the 3.1.10-GA version of the DemoSite for this identification. 

The issue summary is : "If some products exist in Cart, and the Admin modifies the pricing for these products from BLC Admin, then the Cart's Total value does NOT Update.

Here are the steps for reproducing this error : 
1. Add 2 products to a Cart from the DemoSite

4. Refresh the Product Listing page on the DemoSite to check if the Product's Retail price is updated. 
5. Click on the Cart and check for the SubTotal. The Value is still the Old calculation. The new Retail Price has NOT been accounted for Total Calculation.

The SubTotal changes if the Update button next to the Product in the cart is clicked. This issue may produce inconsistent results and incorrect user experience for the end customer. 

Let me know if you need more info. 
- Vivek

issues.title: Admin should rely on Spring's SecurityContext rather than on AdminUser to determine section permissions
issues.body: The issue is that if someone logs into BLC Admin using LDAP, for example, we set the appropriate permissions on the UserDetails object based on the LDAP context.  We create an AdminUser for reference, but do not create relationships to AdminRole or AdminPermission (since they are not owned by BLC).  However, the AdminNavigationServiceImpl.isUserAuthorizedToViewSection uses the database roles and permissions to determine if viewing the section is allowed, rather than the granted authorities.  What should be happening is that the admin should rely on the Spring Security context rather than on the admin user's relationships to roles and permissions to determine access rights.

We found that on the current version 3.1.11-SNAPSHOT / 3.1.10-GA, Upload Asset function Does NOT work for BLC Admin.

We found that there is NO Network call that is issued when the “Upload Asset” button is clicked, and an Image is selected.

On IE 11 and other browsers – Chrome, Firefox etc, this problem does NOT exist, and Upload Asset works properly. 

Steps to reproduce the issue ->
1. Access BLC Admin Console
2. Go to “Media Assets” under Content Section
3. Click on “Upload Asset” and upload an Image
4. Check if the Image is uploaded and the user is presented with the Form where Title and Alt Text needs to be filled.

On selecting the image from the File Browser, the Image does NOT get uploaded, and the form doesn't appear. The user remains on the /admin/assets page. 

We checked the BLC Admin Console on IE 8,9,10 using http://www.browserstack.com and Windows 7 Environment.

issues.title: Rule builder uses syntax to short circuit NullPointerExceptions.  However, when negated it can create false positives.
issues.body:
The issue is that the rule builder uses the following syntax to build, for example, a customer rule for an offer:

`customer.?someProperty == 'some value'`

The above evaluates to true if customer is not null and someProperty equals 'some value'.  The question mark causes an evaluation to false if customer is null.  So, if you have a situation like this and the customer is null, it can cause a rule match when there should not be one:

`! customer.?someProperty == 'some value'`

This might not be an issue as customer should not be null.  However, if that's the case, then the question mark is not likely necessary.

This was originally caused by #405. The exception:

``` console
Editing existing structured content throws this exception:

org.broadleafcommerce.common.exception.ServiceException: Problem updating entity : null

...

...

...

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

at org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.server.service.persistence.validation.RuleFieldValidator.validate(RuleFieldValidator.java:95)
```

org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.server.service.persistence.module.AdornedTargetListPersistenceModule.add(AdornedTargetListPersistenceModule.java:262)

This was caused by the fix to #1176. In this case, the fields on adorned forms are all hidden fields and so `tab.isVisible()` returns false. However, the fix to #1176 had if statements for this case to both render the tab itself and the data in the tab. The correct solution is to have the if statement for displaying the tab itself but always render the data (including hidden fields) whether or not we display the tab.

This was fixed by @apazzolini with b63db0c53129b69ccfb5b7f6fcf40427d617f5bf, but we discovered that this breaks all adorned target collection forms.

issues.title: Exception when using an offer code whose offer has been deleted and recreated
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:
-Create an offer on the admin
-Manually add an offer code to the offer
-Promote/approve changes
-Delete offer
-Promote/approve changes
-Use offer page to enter and submit previously created offer code

When these steps are performed, the expected behavior is that a message shows the offer code as invalid. What happens instead is a 500 error, for an EntityNotFoundException when looking up an OfferImpl based on the ID contained in the OfferCodeImpl. The offer code entity still exists, even though its offer has been deleted. This seems like it would be a minor issue of nothing more than the wrong error message being shown, but it becomes a bigger problem when an offer with a code gets deleted, and a new one with the same code string gets created. The OfferCodeImpl gets looked up not by an ID, but by the code, which is a non-key string. So, when the invalid offer code is still in the DB, it gets returned by the query rather than the newly created one, and throws the 500 error even when a proper one does exist.

Originally I thought that perhaps the offer codes for an offer were not set to cascade properly, but it looks like they are. It could have something to do with the sandboxing/archiving system.

Should be easy to fix. The warning messages are on startup from the composite primary key:

``` console
[artifact:mvn] [ WARN] 10:50:40 RootClass - HHH000038: Composite-id class does not override equals(): org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderLockImpl$OrderLockPk
[artifact:mvn] [ WARN] 10:50:40 RootClass - HHH000039: Composite-id class does not override hashCode(): org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderLockImpl$OrderLockPk
```

When selecting "Enter a code" as the code generation method in the admin, the code can't be saved without switching to "Automatic" and filling in "Number to Generate".

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3674979/5146485/b78317e8-7172-11e4-8421-ef6904bb065c.png)

This causes problems in Eclipse on Windows with not being able to resolve the jdk tools dependency. The original attempt to solve this was in BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite#125 after being referenced from #812. This is a transitive dependency of Solr core, and actually only appears in non-OSX. From the [hadoop-annotations pom.xml](http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/hadoop/hadoop-annotations/2.0.5-alpha/hadoop-annotations-2.0.5-alpha.pom):

```
<profile>
    <id>os.linux</id>
    <activation>
        <os>
            <family>!Mac</family>
        </os>
    </activation>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>jdk.tools</groupId>
            <artifactId>jdk.tools</artifactId>
            <version>1.6</version>
            <scope>system</scope>
            <systemPath>${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar</systemPath>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
</profile>
```

Since this is a system-scoped dependency anyway, there really isn't any reason that we need this in Maven so excluding it should just eliminate further problems. This has been tested out on a different project for a while now on all major OSs (Linux, Windows, OSX) with no side effects.
issues.title: Exclude the jdk tools dependency from Hadoop transitive dependency

issues.body:
This has been proven to happen on both Tomcat 8 and Tomcat 7.0.53. When turning on TRACE level debugging, some classes are detected as not having been transformed even though they should be.

From @ktisdell, this was the output on Tomcat 7.0.53:

``` console
[TRACE] 17:12:53 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.fulfillment.domain.FulfillmentBandImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 17:12:53 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.search.domain.SearchInterceptImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 17:12:53 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed com.broadleafcommerce.tenant.domain.MultiTenantAdminRoleImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 17:12:53 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed com.broadleafcommerce.tenant.domain.MultiTenantAdminUserImpl but didn't
```

For me, I had some of the same (like `MultiTenantAdminUserImpl`) but also some different ones (like `ProductImpl`):

``` console
TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.common.site.domain.SiteImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.common.sitemap.domain.SiteMapGeneratorConfigurationImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.ProductImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.fulfillment.domain.FulfillmentBandImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItemImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.core.search.domain.SearchInterceptImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.cms.file.domain.StaticAssetImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed org.broadleafcommerce.cms.url.domain.URLHandlerImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed com.broadleafcommerce.tenant.domain.MultiTenantAdminRoleImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed com.broadleafcommerce.tenant.domain.MultiTenantAdminUserImpl but didn't
[TRACE] 01:25:00 MergePersistenceUnitManager - Should have transformed com.broadleafcommerce.enterprise.workflow.domain.change.MapStructureImpl but didn't
```

First of all, if I am not mistaken this represents a very serious error state so I think that the debug logging needs to change to the ERROR level (and not TRACE). 

I have also determined it is definitely later versions of Tomcat by trying these permutations:
- Java 7 Tomcat 7 are fine
- Java 7 bytecode with Java 8 JVM and Tomcat 7 is fine
- Java 8 bytecode with Java 8 JVM and Tomcat 7 is fine; looks like it might just be Tomcat 8
- Java 7 bytecode and Tomcat 8 gives me the exception

Other references from Spring issues that have been opened regarding changes to Tomcat's class loader: https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-11447 and https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-11446.

As we have now confirmed that this affects later versions of Tomcat 7 (not just Tomcat 8) then I think this is a very critical issue.

The list, currently, is created via the CategoryDaoImpl.readActiveSubCategoriesByCategory(..) method. This method queries the database via the defaultParentCategory, which possibly misses additional categories that are associated via CategoryXrefImpl, but not via the defaultParentCategory. This is rare, but possible. Also, since ordering is described in CategoryXrefImpl, this query does not take advantage of the proper ordering of subcategories.

An enhancement/fix would be to alter the query to use the category xref table instead.

issues.body:
In the `ConfirmPaymentsRollbackHandler` we are invoking `paymentGatewayCheckoutService.markPaymentAsInvalid()`. This actually does a delete on the given Payment in the underlying `DefaultPaymentGatewayCheckoutService`. Because of the cascades set on `OrderPayment`, the delete cascades down to the `PaymentTransaction`. We are already doing a soft-delete here with an `@SqlDelete` on both of these entities.

However, when you tell Hibernate to do a delete, even though we are soft-deleting it still tries to "clean up" the relationships between `PaymentTransactions`, and so Hibernate removes the VOID transaction relationship to the AUTHORIZE_AND_CAPTURE transaction that it voids.

The fix here is to not rely on Hibernate to do the delete at all, but instead manually set the archived flags.
issues.title: VOIDed Transactions that happen within the payment rollback handler do not keep the parent transaction

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.8-GA

*\* Development Story **

Let's say we need to know price from an `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem` for a Product `X` before any adjustment was added to this order item.
We then use method : `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` and we receive `Y`

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Create an order with an OrderItem for Product `X` having retailPrice `Y`, salePrice = null
2.) Go to Admin and change retailPrice for Product `X` to a new value `Z`, salePrice=null
3.) We then use `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` to get price before adjustments into some service layer.

**Expected result** : `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` should return `Y`
**Actual result** : `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` returns `Z`

Some critical problems we can identify here. 
After invoking `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` method which is supposed to be a `getter`, all fields like `price`, or `retailPrice` or `salePrice` are changed because inside `getSalePrice` or `getRetailPrice` - `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItemImpl#updateSaleAndRetailPrices` is called which alters original values.

Here first of all that getter should `get` value without altering other fields.

A suggestion would be to have another name for this method `getPriceBeforeAdjustments` or at least change documentation which says 

```
/**
     * Returns the unit price of this item.   If the parameter allowSalesPrice is true, will 
     * return the sale price if one exists.
     * 
     * @param allowSalesPrice
     * @return
     */
```

Also .. after invoking `org.broadleafcommerce.core.order.domain.OrderItem#getPriceBeforeAdjustments(true)` we have no way to get old `Y` value! 
Should we do another hit into DB ? just for getting original prices?
issues.title: Original order item prices are lost after invoking getSalePrice or getRetailPrice or getPriceBeforeAdjustments

# Reproduce Step
1. Check out BroadleafCommerce-DemoSite 
2. mvn clean install
3. cd site and run ant jetty-demo
4. cd  admin and run ant jetty-demo
5. Open http://localhost:8081/admin/product/1/delete

Both broadleaf-3.1.2-GA and broadleaf-3.1.8-GA have this issue.

Then you will get those errors. 

I have checked the output, seems the executed SQL sequence is not right: The hibernate first update the BLC_SKU.DEFAULT_PRODUCT_ID to NULL, and then delete the BLC_SKU record. That's the problem since BLC_PRODUCT.DEFAULT_SKU_ID still depend on the SKU record.

Does anyone have any suggestion?
Thanks.

issues.title: Improve SOLR indexing in development
issues.body:
In development, the search index may not be available.   

Currently, the system initializes the search index if the instance is started with `blEventPU.hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto=create`.   

If in any other mode and the index does not exist, a warning shows in the logs ... 

```
[ WARN] 11:11:57 SolrResourceLoader - Can't find (or read) directory to add to classloader: lib (resolved as: /var/folders/dr/lp2fx18n3lq8hbrjx2k6vf500000gp/T/brianpolster/solrhome/lib).
```

For this ticket, we need to do the following ... 
- [ ] Ensure that the default "demo-site" recovers / avoids this error by creating a new index
- [ ] Provide adequate information in the logs when this occurs

~~Provide a reindex search URL that only works in allowed environments (by default dev. only)~~ This doesn't apply to client code - only impacted demo site

issues.title: Adding products for categories and pressing 'Save' button an exception appears into popup
issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.8-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.8-GA

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Go to admin
2.) Select a category
3.) Select Products tab
4.) From 'All products' table select 'Add' -> Popup appears
5.) Press 'Save' button (don't select any entity)

**Expected result** : This button shouldn't be displayed or at least shouldn't display that error message. Or if this entity is `INLINEMULTI` it should add multiple products to category.

**Actual result** : Popup appears informing user with following message : 

```
Problem adding new entity : null

org.broadleafcommerce.common.exception.ServiceException: Problem adding new entity : null
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)

java.lang.NullPointerException
org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.server.service.persistence.module.criteria.FilterMapping.parseFilterValue(FilterMapping.java:152)
```

Class 
`org.broadleafcommerce.common.email.service.info.EmailInfo`
has field for encoding, which can be set from applicationContext.

But following class doesn't respect this setting
`org.broadleafcommerce.common.email.service.message.MessageCreator`

Line 53 
`MimeMessageHelper message = new MimeMessageHelper(mimeMessage, (info.getAttachments() != null && info.getAttachments().size() > 0));`

Should be
`MimeMessageHelper message = new MimeMessageHelper(mimeMessage, (info.getAttachments() != null && info.getAttachments().size() > 0), info.getEncoding());`

Kind regards,

Ali

issues.title: XML Metadata Overrides not working for Product extension
issues.body:
When extending the Product in a custom client code (for example: MyProductImpl), I included XML metadata overrides to exclude multiple unneeded fields of ProductImpl. This worked as expected, excluding these fields from the admin interface from the perspective of MyProductImpl. I then implemented a Manufacturer class that had a @OneToMany relationship to MyProductImpl, @ManyToOne in the inverse direction, and added both classes to the admin interface under the Catalog module. When using @AdminPresentationCollection(readOnly = true) in the ManufacturerImpl class with the intention of showing a list of associated MyProductImpl products, I noticed that the ProductImpl fields that I expected to be excluded were revealed. Eventually, I came to find that the metadata overrides that were in place for ceilingEntity=org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.Product also needed to be implemented for ceilingEntity=com.myproject.core.domain.catalog.MyProduct. This workaround caused the unneeded ProductImpl fields to be excluded from both the perspective of MyProductImpl and ManufacturerImpl.

It seems that these fields should only need to be excluded once, using ceilingEntity=org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.Product (the class higher class of the class hierarchy).

issues.title: Incomplete Update Item Option Workflow Activities
issues.body:
The following activities added by #182 are incomplete:
- ValidateUpdateProductOptionsRequestActivity

This activity, part 1 of the second "Update Item Workflow Configuration" (might want to rename this to "Update Item Options Workflow Configuration"), is incomplete. The current code has an entire nested if statement block that does nothing, although the note in the code states that at some point an exception is to be thrown under an unknown condition. If anyone can elaborate upon a use case of which wanting to throw an exception when trying to update an order item that is part of a bundle, please do so.
- UpdateProductOptionsOrderItemActivity

This activity, part 2 of the second "Update Item Workflow Configuration", is incomplete. The current code does not anticipate or handle BundleOrderItem. A suggestion to fix this would be to add another block to handle BundleOrderItem's although this might involve adding methods to OrderItemService and OrderItemServiceImpl, if following the pattern from the original creation of this activity. Please have someone with a better understanding of the relationship between OrderItems, BundleOrderItems, and DiscreteOrderItems take a look at the updateDiscreteOrderItem method as well, as the logic may also be incorrect.

The only place these are referenced are in CartEndpoint in the updateProductOptions method.

Order "order"
   OrderItem "orderItem" -> price: $5, quantity: 3, order: order
   FulfillmentGroup
      FulfillmentGroupItem -> quantity: 1, totalItemAmount: $5, orderItem: orderItem
   FulfillmentGroup
      FulfillmentGroupItem -> quantity: 1, totalItemAmount: $5, orderItem: orderItem
   FulfillmentGroup
      FulfillmentGroupItem -> quantity: 1, totalItemAmount: $5, orderItem: orderItem
   OrderAdjustment -> value: $2, order: order

Run:
   Money "totalAllItemsAmount" <- calculateTotalPriceForAllFulfillmentItems(order)
   Money "sumProratedAdjAmounts" <- distributeOrderSavingsToItems(order, totalAllItemsAmount)
   fixOrderSavingsRoundingIssues(order, sumProratedAdjAmounts)

Expected Result:
The sum of the ProratedOrderAdjustmentAmounts from the FulfillmentGroupItems should equal the OrderAdjustment Value from the Order

sum(FGI.getProratedOrderAdjustmentAmount().getAmount()) == OrderAdjustment.getValue().getAmount()

Actual Result:
The sum of the Prorated amounts is 2 cents greater than the OrderAdjustment amount. Two of the FulfillmentGroupItems have a value of 0.67 and one has a value of 0.68, adding up to $2.02.

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.8-GA
**Admin demo project** : 3.1.8-GA

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Go to admin
2. Go to Media Assets
3. Type in into 'Search for assets' input 'Close-up' for example
4. Hit enter or 'Search' button

**Expected result** : Assets should be filtered by name typed in into search input, in our case all assets having 'Close-up' into their name.
**Actual result** : Assets aren't filtered and nothing happens.

Probably this bug is because there is a first column that represents thumbnail for the asset.

Small research indicates us that currently search works only if first column is a type of `String` or some simple java primitive.

Same happens for `Settings->Modules` section, where first column is actually  `org.broadleafcommerce.common.config.domain.AbstractModuleConfiguration#configType` having `fieldType` = `org.broadleafcommerce.common.presentation.client.SupportedFieldType#BROADLEAF_ENUMERATION`

Also there is a problem with search if for example we change the column display order for `org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.ProductImpl#defaultCategory` to be the first one in listGrid.

A quick workaround to use column header filtering capabilities.

If this bug is hard to fix, maybe remove/hide the search box if first column isn't searchable (for various reasons, it represents a relation, a broadleaf enumeration, etc)

issues.title: Sku.getRetailPrice() throws an exception if the retail price is not set
issues.body: retailPrice on sku is not a required field in the admin. Therefore, it is possible to create a product with a defaultSku with no retail price. However, calling the getRetailPrice() API on the sku results in an exception if the value is null. This field should either be required, or not throw an exception.

issues.body:
**Broadleaf Framework** : 3.1.8-GA

**Steps to reproduce**

1.) Go to admin
2.) Select a product
3.) Go to description field
4.) Add some text like 'sample'
5.) Select 'sample' text
6.) Change background color to color : `x` (x can be red, blue, etc) 
7.) Save

**Expected result** : After saving product, description field should contain text 'sample' with `x` as as background color
**Actual result** : Product is saved with 'sample' text without `x` as background color. I suppose no background inline styling is generated by redactor.
This is erroneously hardcoded.

issues.body:
The `transform` method looks like:

``` java
@Override
public byte[] transform(ClassLoader loader, String className, Class<?> classBeingRedefined,
        ProtectionDomain protectionDomain, byte[] classfileBuffer) throws IllegalClassFormatException 
```

Lamdbas and other anonymous methods have `null` as the `className` parameter and thus NPEs are thrown when that parameter is used.

issues.title: When terminating SSL at a LB or other proxy, we should have a mechanism to get the scheme and isSecure properties
issues.body: Currently some of the Thymeleaf processors (e.g. PaginationPageLinkProcessor) don't work properly when on a secured page where SSL has been terminated at a LB.  They are making assumptions about the request without taking into account the X-Forwarded-Proto header.  It makes sense to have a utility to evaluate this so that it can be used across components when they need to build a URL to return to the browser.

This is an edge case and does not normally evidence itself, since we generally do not have use cases for adding map field values on an entity add. Rather, this is generally done as an add of a map field value while editing an entity (map fields are not exposed in the add form dialog). Custom fields are handled behind the scenes as a map structure and are not exposed in the add form dialog either. However, there are some use cases in the enterprise module where custom fields are included as part of an add, which can expose this exception.

By addressing this problem, we eliminate the exception from enterprise promotes, and we also pave the way for including custom fields in the add dialog.

issues.body: StatelessSessionFilter is used by the REST services to indicate that sessions should not be created.  Currently, there is a request attribute that can be queried to determine if that's the case.  There are a lot of places in the code where that check is not being done.  We need to fix this, as well as adding a mechanism to ensure that sessions are not created.  Consider adding a SessionlessHttpServletRequestWrapper class.  This can override the getSession methods to throw an exception if something tries to get a session in this case.
issues.title: Ensure that sessions are not created when the StatelessSessionFilter has been run

#1026. Ensuring that sessions are not used when we are not supposed to
be using them.

#1026. Added checks to ensure that we are not attempting to use session
if it is not allowed.  Added the concept of
SessionlessHttpServletRequestWrapper, which now gets set in the
StatelessSessionFilter.  This will throw an exception if a call to
retrieve a session is invoked.

issues.body:
Version : framework version : **broadleaf-3.1.6-GA**
Reproducible with Demo project

Steps to reproduce :
1.   Open admin
2.   Select a product from demo project 
3.   Go to advanced tab
4.   Try to add a product attribute typing in key and value

**Expected result** : Product attribute should be added to specified product
**Actual result** : Validation message appears saying it "fields[name].value: This field is required"

After short investigation this is because of validation framework from admin. 

`
org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.ProductAttributeImpl#name
`
has annotation 

`
VisibilityEnum.HIDDEN_ALL
`

and 

`
 @Column(name = "NAME", nullable=false)
`

by this admin doesn't generate input form for name, so because this field is marked as nullable=false, this field is 'required'. So validation fails ( user hasn't the ability to fill in name).

**Quick workaround** is to add 

`
        <mo:overrideItem ceilingEntity="org.broadleafcommerce.core.catalog.domain.ProductAttribute">
            <mo:field name="name">
                <mo:property name="visibility" value="VISIBLE_ALL"/>
            </mo:field>
        </mo:overrideItem>
`

filling in name when adding product attributes (maybe this aren't used anymore).

#978 - Update the Validator API to the latest JSR version supported by Spring 4.1, remove unused validator annotation processing

The reason this was updated in the first place was in order to support the usage of @EnableConfigurationProperties in non-boot projects where a Validator provider is required. This was moved to common so that it is contributed for both site and admin. The upgrade to the latest version happened after incompatibilities discovered between older versions of validator and spring boot

Provide better support for configuration with and without the presence of various Boot AutoConfiguration classes
#978 - PersistencePackage CustomCriteria is sometimes duplicated

#978 - Add a standardized way to initialize @Configuration classes to come after any Boot AutoConfiguration classes

The original intent of this is to support both the presence and absence of @EnableAutoConfiguration classess at the same time. There are some instances in Broadleaf where we need defaults when Spring Boot is not present, but if boot IS present, we want to delegate to whatever the boot AutoConfiguration is (assuming it is activated). With these constructs, it allows us to safely use @ConditionalOnMissingBean that depends on bean definitions that are originally contributed from boot @EnableAutoConfiguration classes

issues.body: Both persistence providers can listen for similar properties (i.e. map properties). The Map version run last and can override persistence operations in the rule provider. This ends up being the same data in the 3.0.x line, so this is actually a minor issue there. However, in 3.1.x and beyond, this ends up overriding the dirty state of the property. This still is not a big deal, as dirty state is really only monitored by the enterprise modules. This is a critical bug when using the enterprise modules.

issues.body: I noticed that, in the admin, when modifying content via the WYSIWYG editor, when using the registered trademark symbol (®), or when using "®" in the raw HTML editor, Redactor is replacing the "®" value with the unicode symbol.  This tends to cause problems between different browsers and on different operating systems.  Sometimes you see the proper code rendered, and sometimes you get garbled binary data in place of the character.  This issue likely needs to be opened with Redactor, but since it is affecting Broadleaf, I'm opening the issue here for tracking.

issues.body:
This problem can primarily evidence itself in equals methods on Broadleaf entities, but requires special circumstances in a given Broadleaf implementation. It is possible under special circumstances that Hibernate will return a JavassistLazyInitializer proxied entity, rather than an instance of the entity class itself. If the proxy instance is passed to equals, and the equals methods attempts to inspect the passed in proxy via field access, the field values will be null. This can cause an equals call to return false when it should return true. It is the behavior of Hibernate lazy proxies that its fields are not populated until one or more of the method proxies on the entity are accessed.

There are several scenarios in which Hibernate will return a proxied entity:

1) If Session.load(..) is called, which is analogous to JPA EntityManager.getReference(..)
2) If a lazy fetch for a ManyToOne or OneToOne relationship is annotated for the entity in question (this causes Hibernate to proxy to enable lazy fetch behavior)
3) If Session.get(..) (which is analogous to EntityManager.find(..)) is called for an entity that has already been loaded into the Hibernate session earlier via item 1 or item 2 above.

Broadleaf performs none of the above, so this generally does not show up as a problem. However, if an implementation performs any of the above, the behavior can show itself. There are several known workarounds:

1) Use compile time instrumentation for a lazy fetch field so that the dynamic behavior is enabled at the field access level. The drawback here is that this requires an extra build step during project compilation.
2) Or, remove the lazy fetch param, if applicable
3) Or, use EntityManager.find rather than EntityManager.getReference

The main goal of opening this issue is to mark the work required to address the possibility of the above situation occurring in an appropriate way in the framework.
issues.title: Field level comparisons can fail for entities when using a Hibernate lazy proxy

issues.body:
Thread 1 starts checkout which locks the order. While thread1 is still in the process of checkout, thread2 comes in. Because of how the lock is acquired and where the exceptions are thrown, the finally block will cause thread2 to clear the lock set by thread1. When thread3 comes in, even if thread1 is still in the process of checking out the order thread3 will also continue to check out the order.

As @ktisdell mentioned, while this thread-safe checkout works within a single server, this will not work in a multi-server environment since there isn't current a way to lock an order on checkout between servers. If threads on different servers attempt to check out an order then both will actually succeed.
issues.title: If 2 threads attempt to check out an Order, thread 2 will clear the lock set by thread 1

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #909 - Move the exception on lock acquisition failure from checkout to outside of the try-catch block so that subsequent threads do not clear the lock set by the first thread

issues.body:
The test execution should not be based on specific ordering of inserting data in the database but the tests for successfully adding an item to the cart does, since it uses `skuDao.readFirstSku()`. The reason for this is that because of other tests that insert data into the `BLC_SKU` table do not always populate the `startDate` column. If it just so happened that that data population test happened first, then this test fails.

This was apparent when running the integration tests on Java 8.
issues.title: AddToCart test is too dependent on specific data ordering

issues.body:
We use PostgreSQL as database. We find in our environments, some products are not indexed due to the fact that PostgreSQL does not guarantee records order of returned result for query with limit and offset. see http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.2/static/queries-limit.html for details.

Without order by clause, we found out the first page of active products are not consistent with other pages. Change limit values can affect the results. So in order to make indexing work correctly with PostgreSQL, order clause should be applied to the query. 

This should affect both 3.0 and 3.1 latest releases as they use the same query to get active products for a category.
issues.title: Products not fully indexed by solr search indexing for PostgreSQL

issues.body:
1. In demosite, register a new customer
2. Add a new default customer address in the customer's account detail
3. Select the new customer address from the address drop down in the account details screen and edit one or more of the values
4. Review the address records in BLC_ADDRESS

A new Address record is created for the edit. The original address is left untouched in the database (incorrect). The expected behavior is for the target address to be changed, rather than creating a new record and orphaning the old one.
I think this happened after the permissions refactor. If you go to a product that has additional Skus and then try to edit one of those Skus then the entire form is readonly.

issues.body: We have a mechanism to refresh customer state after a customer is saved to the database.  This makes it more convenient and transparent to ensure that the customer in session is actually the freshest version.  The issue is that there are a number of properties on Customer that are reset after this save process.  They include cookied, anonymous, loggedIn, and others.  It is expected that these values are correct, but they are not after the customer in CartState is saved.  I'm proposing that the above properties be managed in session, and we have convenience methods on CustomerState to set/get these values.
issues.title: Move at least some transient properties off of Customer and into CustomerState

issues.body:
DefaultPaymentGatewayCheckoutService utilizes `orderService.findOrderById()` however there have been instances where Hibernate's second level cache never gets invalidated and a cached order without an order number of 'null' is returned hence causing a `/confirmation/null` redirect for the customer. The order in the DB however is correct, just the entity manager in some cases returns a stale instance. It seems to be very difficult and somewhat impossible to reproduce this symptom locally, but seems to intermittently happen on some environments. The root cause of why the cache isn't invalidated is not known yet, however the following safe fix should be implemented in the case it is cached.  

We need to add a new method on the OrderDao that allows you to call em.refresh on the entity manager to make sure that the order instance returned is from the DB and not a cached instance.
issues.title: DefaultPaymentGatewayCheckoutService may return you a `confirmation/null` in some cases where you have Hibernate' second level cache enabled

issues.title: There is no gateway configured for Passthrough Payment

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #785 - adding a Default PassthroughPayment rollback service and gateway configuration

issues.body:
If a Database driven system property has no value (e.g. is null or blank) then the system should default to the value contained in the file based property file.

In some cases, it may be desired to blank out the value.    For this purpose, the string _blank_ can be used which will be translated to "".
issues.title: SystemProperty Service ignores file based property settings if a DB record exists

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #779

Merge pull request #779 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-2547-pagetype-fix-2

Nav Update Error

issues.body: Parent categories should not be allowed to be reordered, since they share a table with the child categories list in category. The important part is to order products in a category.
issues.title: Reordering a parent category from the product perspective can generate an incorrect display order

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #778  - Make sure null display order adorned target items appear last in the admin by default
#778 - disable parent category reordering from the product
#778  - disable parent category reordering from the category perspective

issues.title: Font Color and Back Color buttons in Redactor bar in the Admin do nothing.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #776 - Removed fontcolor.js plugin from the maven license plugin.
#776 - Add missing font color support for redactor.

issues.title: File operation attempted on file that is not provided in work area.
issues.body:
Reported on stack overflow.

HTTP ERROR 500
Problem accessing /admin/asset/uploadAsset. Reason:

File operation attempted on file that is not in provided work area. D:\DOCUME~1\Gutha\LOCALS~1\Temp\5e\a2\gal_w01.jpg.  Work area = D:\DOCUME~1\Gutha\LOCALS~1\Temp\/5e/a2/

The following was reported at info@ email.  

...  it seems that you can't change the Primary Image for products any more. To reproduce, go to the edit product view, such as: http://demo*.broadleafcommerce.org/admin/product/ click on "Select/Update Image", select any image other then the one currently set for the product. The edit screen then shows the new image. Click save and the old image is back.

Please test / verify on 3.0.X, 3.1.X, and PrivateDemo
issues.title: Changing primary image doesn't work

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #771 - Ensure that media map fields are parsed prior to the generic map fields

issues.body: The error message that pops up says 'URLs cannot end in a slash'. Should be a simple modification to change the logic of the UriPropertyValidator.
issues.title: A category cannot be saved in the admin for just '/'

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #768 - Allow URIs to be saved for the root ('/') URL

issues.body:
If an entity derives its dynamic forms from another entity, an admin user must have full rights to the "definition entity" in order to edit the "configurable entity".  

For example, a user with rights to edit a "Page" also must have rights to edit "Page Templates".

The desired behavior is that this dependency should be removed.
issues.title: Dynamic Form Building should use security of contained entity

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Address #767 - ensure page and structured content have read permissions to page template and sc template respectively

Address #767 by introducing a securityCeilingClass concept.     This allows a dynamic form to get generated based off of a given ceiling entity but then have its security based off of a secondary entity.

Address #767 by introducing a securityCeilingClass concept.     This allows a dynamic form to get generated based off of a given ceiling entity but then have its security based off of a secondary entity.

Merge pull request #767 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-2525-get-skuMediaXrefs-ignoreDefaultSku

Created a New Getter Method for SkuMedia that Does not Reference the DefaultSku

issues.body: This applies to inventory and product bundles. This mitigates the needs for a complex query to select default skus and additional skus for a property match, as that complex query performs slowly on large catalogs.
issues.title: Require product selection before sku selection when doing a sku lookup

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #766 - Deprecate the SkuRestrictionFactory and remove it from use in the SkuCustomPersistenceHandler

issues.body:
If you leave a session open using https for a long time, so that it expires, you can get a NullPointer when you come back to the browser and click a link, or refresh the page.

I am using Broadleaf 3.1.0 GA.  Bug was found in development using embedded Jetty and is reproducible (if you are patient enough).

Code snippet from class assumes that _session_ can never be null when settingAttribute, however prior to this it checks for it being null before accessing an attribute.  So the later should probably have the same protection. This is in  SessionFixationProtectionFilter.doFilter and I believe happens only when the request is secure.

```
String activeIdSessionValue = session == null ? null : (String) session.getAttribute(SESSION_ATTR);
...
session.setAttribute(SESSION_ATTR, token);  // < -- at line 100
```

issues.body:
When you attempt to do so, the following queries are executed:

``` console
SQL - delete from BLC_SKU_FULFILLMENT_EXCLUDED where SKU_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_SKU_FEE_XREF where SKU_ID=?
delete from BLC_SKU_FULFILLMENT_FLAT_RATES where SKU_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_SKU_OPTION_VALUE_XREF where SKU_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_SKU_MEDIA_MAP where BLC_SKU_SKU_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_CATEGORY_PRODUCT_XREF where CATEGORY_PRODUCT_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_CATEGORY_PRODUCT_XREF where CATEGORY_PRODUCT_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_PRODUCT_ATTRIBUTE where PRODUCT_ATTRIBUTE_ID=?
SQL - UPDATE BLC_PRODUCT SET ARCHIVED = 'Y' WHERE PRODUCT_ID = ?
SQL - delete from BLC_MEDIA where MEDIA_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_MEDIA where MEDIA_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_PRODUCT_SKU_XREF where SKU_ID=?
SQL - delete from BLC_SKU where SKU_ID=?
```

As you can see, the Product is set the 'archived' but the related defaultSku is hard-deleted. Because of the foreign key constraint from BLC_DISCRETE_ORDER_ITEM the delete fails.

Reproduce:
1. Use an extension of Product
2. Go to the admin and add a new product of the extension type
3. Save it (don't fill out any fields) which will trigger validation errors

A bunch of fields are removed from the form and in the logs you see:

```
[ WARN] 12:13:49 ErrorsProcessor - Could not field field fields[defaultSku__name].value within the main form
[ WARN] 12:13:49 ErrorsProcessor - Could not field field fields[defaultSku__retailPrice].value within the main form
```

Also, the form errors shows defaultSku__retailPrice for the validation error rather than 'Name' (field name vs the friendly name).

issues.body:
Originally reported at BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite#84 by @RapitTransit. Description is copied here:

> ```
> Caused by: org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: ERROR: [doc=1] unknown field 'length_tdouble'
>     at org.apache.solr.update.DocumentBuilder.toDocument(DocumentBuilder.java:174)
> ```
> 
> Example
> 
> ``` java
>     public static final FieldType TRIEINT = new FieldType("tint", "Trie Integer");
>     public static final FieldType TRIELONG = new FieldType("tlong", "Trie Long");
>     public static final FieldType TRIEDOUBLE = new FieldType("tdouble", "Trie Double");
>     public static final FieldType TRIEDATE = new FieldType("tdate", "Trie Date");
> ```
> 
> schema.xml, does not work:
> 
> ``` xml
>         <!-- some trie-coded dynamic fields for faster range queries -->
>         <dynamicField name="*_ti" type="tint" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_tl" type="tlong" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_td" type="tdouble" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_tdt" type="tdate" indexed="true" stored="false" />
> ```
> 
> Fix
> 
> ``` xml
>         <!-- some trie-coded dynamic fields for faster range queries -->
>         <dynamicField name="*_tint" type="tint" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_tlong" type="tlong" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_tdouble" type="tdouble" indexed="true" stored="false" />
>         <dynamicField name="*_tdate" type="tdate" indexed="true" stored="false" />
> ```

Recommended fix is to change FieldType values to ti, tl, td, tdt

issues.title: Filtering by order submit date and then applying a sort to that field throws an exception

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixes #736 - Fix an issue where filtering by a date and then sorting caused an exception
The real cause here is that when the criteria inputs were updated with the URL parameters, we were just parsing out the parameters into a JSON object (via BLCAdmin.history.getUrlParameters()) but forgetting that the parameter values themselves could be URI-encoded. This led itself to dates only, because date filter values have a space in them (yyyy.mm.dd HH:MM:SS). The criteria value was getting overwritten with yyyy.mm.dd%20HH:MM:SS and then when we attempted to sort that, the final value for the criteria ended up being yyyy.mm.dd%2520HH:MM:SS in order to encode the '%' sign.

(cherry picked from commit e5ae7e812c8f66c30bd8a82b72cebc3339eabe28)

The real cause here is that when the criteria inputs were updated with the URL parameters, we were just parsing out the parameters into a JSON object (via BLCAdmin.history.getUrlParameters()) but forgetting that the parameter values themselves could be URI-encoded. This led itself to dates only, because date filter values have a space in them (yyyy.mm.dd HH:MM:SS). The criteria value was getting overwritten with yyyy.mm.dd%20HH:MM:SS and then when we attempted to sort that, the final value for the criteria ended up being yyyy.mm.dd%2520HH:MM:SS in order to encode the '%' sign.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #678 - need to null out the reference to the Order for all the OrderPayments as they are not deleted but Archived. This means we need to remove the not-null constraint on the order for OrderPayment. The implications of this mean that if Orders are purged from the system, there may be Archived payments in the DB that will not have a reference to an Order. This is to support keeping logs of any payment transaction responses that are received from a third party gateway for auditing purposes.

issues.body:
3.1.0-SNAPSHOT:

Error:

```
org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.ImportScriptException: Error during statement execution (file: '/config/bc/sql/load_admin_permissions.sql'): INSERT INTO BLC_ADMIN_PERMISSION (ADMIN_PERMISSION_ID, DESCRIPTION, NAME, PERMISSION_TYPE, IS_FRIENDLY) VALUES (-1,'Default Permission','PERMISSION_OTHER_DEFAULT', 'OTHER', 0)
```

Example:

``` SQL
INSERT INTO BLC_ADMIN_PERMISSION (ADMIN_PERMISSION_ID, DESCRIPTION, NAME, PERMISSION_TYPE, IS_FRIENDLY) VALUES (-1,'Default Permission','PERMISSION_OTHER_DEFAULT', 'OTHER', 0);
```

Fix:

``` SQL
INSERT INTO BLC_ADMIN_PERMISSION (ADMIN_PERMISSION_ID, DESCRIPTION, NAME, PERMISSION_TYPE, IS_FRIENDLY) VALUES (-1,'Default Permission','PERMISSION_OTHER_DEFAULT', 'OTHER',  false);
```

    at org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.server.service.persistence.module.BasicPersistenceModule.remove(BasicPersistenceModule.java:952 .........

In a case where one implements a SaltSource that generates a random salt to store on the password, the functionality to look up the change password token is broken.  In these cases, the salt is often stored with the password (e.g. {hash}:{salt}).  The change password functionality makes the assumption that the salt is the same each time to encrypt the token.  In this case, the salt is stored on the encrypted token rather than being static.  It is also randomly generated, so any additional call to re-encrypt the token and then find it in the database will never work. We need to investigate a work around.
issues.title: Forgot password functionality no longer works with a random Salt

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#670. As a default strategy, we are appending the salt to the generated
token.  This way we can re-encode the token to see if it is actually in
the database.
