issues.title: Default Complete Secure Credit Card Checkout throws Stack Trace and Null Credit Card Module should allow current month till the last day of the month as a valid exp. date

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #658 - fixing stack trace and expiry date issue on checkout form

issues.body: The getSalt(Customer) was deprecated in favor of getSalt(Customer cust, String unecodedPwd).  However, the encodePassword(String clearText, Customer cust) still uses the deprecated method.
issues.title: Change password no longer works with Salt

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#650. Changed the entire customer service to use encodePassword, rather
than each method individually invoking the passwordEncoder and
determining their own salt.

#650. Changed the entire customer service to use encodePassword, rather
than each method individually invoking the passwordEncoder and
determining their own salt.
(cherry picked from commit d033fea40e0690d9b211d2b1e15f07e1857eef4c)

issues.title: All out of box roles need to be tested
issues.body:
Some concerns that out of box roles may be missing entity permissions resulting in 403 errors in the admin. 

Ensure that all out of box roles are working for demo and private demo.

issues.body:
I'm not sure if the totalitarian flag is supposed to be supported or not, since it is hidden from the admin in the 3.0.x line. But it seemed to be implemented in code, so I was testing out using it.  For the most part it seemed to work correctly, but I ran into the following case where it did not (tested with 3.0.8-GA):

Conditions: 
An order with the following offers applied:
a totalitarian item level offer IO.
a fulfillment level offer FO with an adjustment amount greater than IO. 

The goal being FO should apply and IO should not. But what is happening is that the IO is applied first, the blc_order_item_dtl_adj record is added, and the order_item.price is set, then when FO is applied the IO adjustment is removed but the order_item.price is not reset.  So the order subtotal reflects having IO apply, but the blc_order_item_dtl_adj record doesn't exist.
issues.title: Pricing error with totalitarian item level offer

issues.body:
Redactor register's a "click.redactor-image-resize-hide" for the RTE control when you click on an image.   (A small "edit" box appears above the image when in this state).  

When save is pressed on an entity form in the admin with this selector active, an "opacity" setting is passed in as part of the image tag.   This causes an `NumberFormatException` during the save process.

Need to prevent this error during save.

To recreate this error, select an image inside of an RTE field.    Select the image causing the "edit" box.  Then, modify the image by resizing it.    Hit save and you should get the error.
issues.title: When edit box is live on Redactor, an antisami exception is sometimes triggered due to the opacity tag attached to the underlying image.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#616 - Prevent Antisamy exception in rare cases

Make sure we defocus off of any currently selected elements before submitting the form. (Like an image that's in process of being resized in Redactor)

issues.body:
Description:- Unable to login to admin after creating a new user.

Steps to reproduce
1. Login to admin via admin/admin and create a new user (username - test, Password - test)
2. Provide proper role/permission.
3. logout from admin and try to login with new user(test).

Expected result.
Should be able to login.

Actual result
Unable to login.

(I observed when we create a new user we are not adding the salt value in BLC_ADMIN_USER table. Example if we see for admin we have password as admin{1}

but if we observe value of password column for new user added it will be without salt value i.e ID. (test)
issues.title: Admin Salt encryption Issue

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Cherry pick change from develop to add default permissions for admin access after successful login.

Addresses #355 and #614.

Notes:
- Fixed issue with salt not being applied during add (if the salt was on the id field).
- Fixed issue with salt being applied twice in some cases.
- Password is not required but if left blank on add it will generate a random password.   If using a salt, no user will be able to login with this password.
- If password is left blank on the update admin then the password field will be ignored.

issues.title: Exception when viewing entity that doesn't have a menu entry

issues.body:
For instance, this MVEL expression will break parsing in the admin for something like targeting an item with a specific product attribute:

``` java
MvelHelper.convertField("BOOLEAN",orderItem.?product.?getProductAttributes()["attrname"])==true
```

It's actually successfully saved in the database and executed on the site (as in, the offer will successfully apply to the order item) but it just won't nicely parse back into the dropdown-based rule builder in the admin.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #599 - Allow the admin rule builder to successfully parse method invocations for targeted fields
#599 - Fix rule builders being broken for Money fields

issues.body:
This does not impact execution of the application but it presents a red herring for other debugging efforts.

I believe this only occurs in Hibernate 4. By removing the property from our persistence unit declarations the log message goes away. We had it set to false anyway and I'm pretty sure that Hibernate 4 just ignores that property.

issues.body:
All URLs are reachable even when the entity is deleted, since the entity is only soft-deleted (archived). This applies to all entities that can be looked up by URL via HandlerMappings:
- StaticAssets
- Products
- Categories
issues.title: URLs are still reachable even after the entity been deleted (Products, Categories, Static Assets)

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #586 - Change the query for finding products/categories by URL to take into account whether the product is active or not (using start/end dates) and whether or not it has been archived

issues.body:
in the demo site of version 3.0.3, translation of products are well shown. Looking into the table BLC_TRANSLATION, i do see the records like here:

| TRANSLATION_ID | ENTITY_ID | ENTITY_TYPE | FIELD_NAME | LOCALE_CODE | TRANSLATED_VALUE |
+----------------+-----------+-------------+-----------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| -56 | 3 | Sku | longDescription | es | Picante, maduro pimienta que se mezcla junto con el ajo, la cebolla, pasta de tomate y una pizca de azúcar de caña para hacer de esto una salsa suave. Maravilloso en huevos, aves de corral, carne de cerdo o pescado, esta salsa se ??mezcla para hacer los adobos y sopas ricas. |
| -256 | 3 | Sku | longDescription | fr | Tangy, venu de Cayenne poivron flux avec l'ail, l'oignon pâte de tomate, et un soupçon de sucre de canne pour en faire une sauce onctueuse avec une morsure. Magnifique sur les œufs, la volaille, le porc ou le poisson, cette sauce marie pour faire des marinades et des soupes riches. |
| -55 | 3 | Sku | name | es | Salsa de la Muerte Saltante |
| -255 | 3 | Sku | name | fr | Hot Sauce Hoppin |

In the Admin module, the translations are not visible. When I add a new translation with the admin Module, in BLC_TRANSLATION a new record appears like here:

| TRANSLATION_ID | ENTITY_ID | ENTITY_TYPE | FIELD_NAME | LOCALE_CODE | TRANSLATED_VALUE |
+----------------+-----------+-------------+-----------------+-------------+------------------+
| 101 | 3 | Product | defaultSku.name | fr | Hoppin piquante |

One can see that the original records that work have a value for ENTITY_TYPE='sku' whereas the new records have ENTITY_TYPE='Product'. Note that the fieldname is also different: name <>defaultSku.name !

This seams to be the reason why the used translation are not shown in admin and the new translations are not shown in the demo-site. I guess this is bug or do i have a somwhere a wrong record in the DB ?

Theo Schumacher 
    Beginner
    Beginner

In latest 3.0.6-GA, quantity not equal to zero comparison in verify method (Line 357) of FulfillmentGroupItemStrategyImpl.java does not work as expected. Though the value is zero, the comparison is still true and "Not enough fulfillment group items found for DiscreteOrderItem" exception is thrown. 

This may be a result of autounboxing issue. It works if I override the method to explicit unboxing the value as entry.getValue().intValue() != 0.
issues.title: FulfillmentGroupItemStrategyImpl verify method quanity comparison error

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Copied change from 3.1 verify method to fix issue #578 caused by Integer comparison failing due to unexpected auto-boxing behavior.

issues.body: This has been excluded from `BroadleafAdminRequestProcessor`. This can cause problems when your default locale is `en` rather than `en_US`. philippeuniverse:
This looks like a bug. Could you open a ticket for it on https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/Br ... rce/issues? We are managing those roles and permissions in the framework so that's where we should make this fix.

Entity validation occurs on input and there is no chance for input when a field is marked as readonly. As a result, the server interprets it as null/empty input and if that field is also marked as required, then it will fail validation with no opportunity to modify it (even if there is an actual value for that field).
issues.title: Readonly fields can still fail validation if they are required

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #552 - Add a hidden input for the actual field value to all readonly fields and indicate if they are required or not

issues.body:
Start tomcat with user.language=ro user.region=RO for example.
This would force admin to display prices with "," sign as a decimalSeparator and "." as groupingSeparator.

Prices are displayed well but we aren't able to save the Product because the retail and sale Price validation fails with a message "Field must be a valid number"
This is because the `org.broadleafcommerce.openadmin.server.service.persistence.validation.BasicFieldTypeValidator` tries to validate value that uses "," as a decimalSeparator and doesn't take into account that value is formatted in a different locale.
issues.title: Pricing conversion problem after starting tomcat with custom user.language and user.region values

issues.body:
Like in title I can login to customer with Deactivated = 1 I solved this by my way changing in applicationContext-Security:

SELECT USER_NAME,PASSWORD,TRUE FROM BLC_CUSTOMER WHERE USER_NAME=? AND DEACTIVATED = 0"

"SELECT c.USER_NAME,r.ROLE_NAME from BLC_CUSTOMER c                                           JOIN BLC_CUSTOMER_ROLE cr ON c.CUSTOMER_ID = cr.CUSTOMER_ID                                           JOIN BLC_ROLE r ON cr.ROLE_ID = r.ROLE_ID WHERE USER_NAME=? AND DEACTIVATED = 0" />

But still it's not 100% working way. Better would be if user who is deactivated get info after trying to log that his account is deactivated

issues.title: Saving an offer with an empty order item qualifier causes the offer to fail on subsequent saves

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #510 - Fix problems in the rule builder that caused unnecessary JSON to be sent to the server when there were no actual rules inside of a grouping. Also refactored the build process a bit to be more explicit about the type of object that the collectDataFromNode method expects (a jquery-enabled object).

Merge pull request #510 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-1827-criteria-qty-match

Validate quantity in offer matches rule

issues.body:
Scenario:
1. User adds a $5 item to their cart
2. User goes to the checkout page
3. While the user is sitting on the checkout page, and admin user goes and changes the price of the item to $6
4. The user goes and selects their shipping method and continues to the next step

When the user changes their shipping it triggers a complete reprice of the order (`orderService.save(order, true)`). Thus the item will now unexpectedly cost $6.

It seems like an error for it to work like this out of the box. A few options that I can see off the bat:
1. Communicate price changes back to the frontend. This could actually be as simple as putting a new property on the `PricingContext` that is passed to the `blPricingWorkflow` for _orderPricesChanged_, allowing the system to communicate changes to the user
2. Be more explicit about what _type_ of thing you want to reprice. In the above example, we just want to price fulfillment and we don't want to really touch the order items. We could potentially define different price regions (fulfillment + taxes, items, others(?)). If we want similar concepts to what we already have we could have the main pricing workflow invoke a `blFulfillmentPricingWorkflow` and a `blOrderItemPricingWorkflow` maybe.
3. Ability to "lock" prices once the user gets to a certain point in checkout (I don't really like this one)

Kinda spitballing here but it seems we could do better on this front in the framework.

issues.body:
When two automatically considered combinable offers exist in system, offers will not applied. Remove one offer or make it not automatical considered will have correct result. Latest 3.0.3-GA is affected.

In ItemOfferProcessorImpl, the two offers are considered and used in the calculation of potential savings. However, promotion discounts of PromotableOrderItemPriceDetail are cleared after calculation in line 503-505 and offered is not applied afterwards.

issues.body:
In the 3.0.x source there is currently a @JoinTable annotation on both OrderImpl.addedOfferCodes and OfferCodeImpl.orders which I believe is invalid according to the hibernate documentation:

"As seen previously, the other side don't have to (must not) describe the physical mapping: a simple mappedBy argument containing the owner side property name bind the two." -
http://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/core/4.1/manual/en-US/html/ch07.html#d5e5537

This seems to be the cause of some strange behavior I have been seeing where duplicate records are intermittently being added to this mapping table.  You may want to remove one of them.
issues.title: Duplicate JoinTable mapping on OfferCodeImpl.orders

issues.body:
In latest 3.0.3-GA release, when a 100% off (free) offer is defined for an on sale product, the total savings calculation uses retail price instead of sale price. In shopping cart view, item total savings will be higher than displayed sale price, causing total price of item to be incorrect. However, order subtotal is not affected. 

For example, if an free offer is created for Hot Sauces, add on sale product Hurtin' Jalepeno Hot Sauce to cart will display as, item price $4.49, total savings $5.49, total $1.50, and subtotal is empty which is zero.

After some debugging, the problem seems to relate to line 129 of chooseSaleOrRetailAdjustments method in PromotableOrderItemPriceDetailImpl.java where in this case saleAdjustmentPrice is equal to retailAdjustmentPrice and retail price is honored.
issues.title: Total savings and total calculation error for 100% off offer

issues.body:
One of the main symptoms of this issue is seeing a generic javascript exception dialog in the admin stating that an error occurred. Upon further investigation of the http response for an AJAX request (i.e. viewing the response in FireBug), we see that the following exception occurs:

``` java
XSRF token mismatch (null). Session may be expired.
```

There may be other exceptions as well related to incorrect or missing request parameters.

THE CAUSE

There is a ThreadLocal context used by Broadleaf that stores a reference to the current web request on the current request thread. These contexts are normally cleaned up at the end of the Broadleaf request lifecycle. However, in the case of the admin, these contexts were not being cleaned up. By itself, this is not necessarily an issue, as the context values would be overwritten on the next user request. However, on BroadleafRequestContext, the setWebRequest(..) method was only updating the HttpServletRequest instance if it was not null. In essence, this was causing an earlier instance of HttpServletRequest to be bound to the thread. Since containers generally use thread pools for user request threads, it's possible to have an incorrect request instance bound to a user thread when that thread is re-used from the container thread pool. This appears to primarily occur in AJAX requests in the admin, but could show up elsewhere, too (pretty much anywhere BroadleafRequestContext.getRequest() is used).

THE SOLUTION

Include ThreadLocal cleanup for admin requests and fix the way the request setter works in BroadleafRequestContext.

issues.title: PageServiceImpl creates PageDTO CMS URL's incorrectly (inconsistent with StaticAssetPathService and StructuredContentService)

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #481 and #478 - handling another scenario

Merge pull request #481 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-1824-qty-rule-cache-evict

Quantity Based Rule Cache Eviction
#481 and #478 - fixing framework CMS url path creation - PageDTO and StructuredContentDTO should now call the StaticAssetPathService to rewrite any static asset paths

issues.title: ProductOptionValueProcessor leaves Thymeleaf attribute in rendered HTML

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #479 - ProductOptionValueProcessor leaves Thymeleaf attribute in rendered HTML

issues.body:
There is an issue in the line below where originalValue is checking for 'cmsstatic' and if it finds it, prepends the asset path.

https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/blob/develop/admin/broadleaf-contentmanagement-module/src/main/java/org/broadleafcommerce/cms/structure/service/StructuredContentServiceImpl.java#L405

This creates several issues, such as producing static assets with /cmsstatic/cmsstatic and in other cases, prepending to full html content blocks.
issues.title: StructuredContentService is rewriting the path incorrectly

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #481 and #478 - handling another scenario
#481 and #478 - fixing framework CMS url path creation - PageDTO and StructuredContentDTO should now call the StaticAssetPathService to rewrite any static asset paths

Hi,

issues.title: Cannot Delete a Customer from the Admin
issues.body:
There's a FK constraint error when trying to delete a customer through the Admin

javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (BLC_CUSTOMER_ROLE, CONSTRAINT `FK548EB7B17470F437` FOREIGN KEY (`CUSTOMER_ID`) REFERENCES `BLC_CUSTOMER` (`CUSTOMER_ID`))

It appears the algorithm to use the "asset.server.url.prefix" isn't consistent among the CMS services. The ContentProcessor tag calls structuredContentService.buildFieldValues which translates field definitions into a StructuredContentDTO. During this translation it also translates the static asset url's to use any server url prefixes. However, the URLRewriteProcessor calls the StaticAssetPathService to determine the url to generate. This algorithm is not consistent. For example, given: ``` xml asset.server.url.prefix.internal=cmsstatic asset.server.url.prefix=http://static.mycompany.com/cmsstatic ``` StructuredContentService gives you: ``` html ``` StructuredAssetService gives you: ``` html ```
issues.title: StructuredContentService buildFieldValues is not consistent with StaticAssetPathService build asset path

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #458 - StructuredContentService needs to call StaticAssetPathService to determine URL's

issues.body:
Hi all,

I am running the demo app on localhost, at the product editing page on admin console, when I click the "Select/Upload Asset" button on the text editor of product description, a dialog pops up and loads images of the site, then I click the upload button and upload an image, when upload completes, the dialog closes and nothing happens, the uploaded image is not shown. Then I open the dialog again, the new image was on the top of the list, but when I double click the image, the dialog closes and the image is not shown on the text editor.

 I am using firefox 24.0, when I doube click the image I want to insert, firebug shows an 404 error

"NetworkError: 404 Not Found - https://localhost:8444/cmsstatic/product/1/2013-03-14%2021.08.37.jpg"

Inspect the dom tree in firebug and see that an img tag has been inserted into the editor, with an incorrect 'src' attribute.

Then when I click save, an error was thrown

issues.title: Admin - Product description cannot insert images

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Added HTMLFieldPersistenceProvider to allow images to be inserted into HTML elements when the applicationContext for admin is not set to the root.   Addresses #455.
Adjustment to #455 that accounts for sites that do not use the default root application context.    This also addresses BroadleafCommerce/QA#469

issues.body:
There's an error in the admin, when you try to associate other structured content (for example an image) to another structured content (for example a blog post)

This seems to happen ONLY from a new entity modal. If you save the entity first then try to edit it and add the image from the main basic entity form, it seems to work fine.

issues.title: Exception while adding second asset through admin

Originally reported at https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite/issues/34. Copied below.

issues.title: Several programmatic transactions on rare occasions might not be rolled back immediately, causing the transaction to stay open until it times out (~60 seconds - depending on config) and then rolls back

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #449 - fixes rare transaction rollback problem for programmatic transactions

issues.body:
The issue is described in this Stack Overflow post:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13575280/jersey-json-array-with-1-element-is-serialized-as-object

And in this Forum post:
http://forum.broadleafcommerce.org/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1842&p=5047&hilit=rest#p5047

We originally fixed this by doing the following, as is stated in the forum post:

``` xml
<init-param>
  <param-name>com.sun.jersey.config.property.packages</param-name>
  <param-value>org.codehaus.jackson.jaxrs</param-value>
</init-param>
```

It appears that this no longer works. @apazzolini I think you excluded all of Jackson jars from Jersey.  I have a feeling that, though things generally continue to work, that is why this solution no longer works. I will try to resolve this by adding some of those dependencies back. Any specifics jars or versions that I should avoid?
issues.title: JAXRS JSON serialization of a collection of 1 object does not render an array

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#448. Updated Jersey. Also removed some dependency exclusions that
involve Jersey and Jackson for serialization of JSON for REST services.
#448 - We also need to manage the jersey-client and jersey-core libraries

issues.body:
Here's an example of changing the the value of prominent to false:

``` java
@Entity
@Table(name = "MY_BLC_PRODUCT")
@AdminPresentationMergeOverrides(
            @AdminPresentationMergeOverride(name = "defaultCategory", mergeEntries =
                @AdminPresentationMergeEntry(propertyType = PropertyType.AdminPresentation.PROMINENT,

public class MyProductImpl extends ProductImpl {
```

issues.body:
This works fine with a global salt but if you try to use a specific salt on a per-customer basis then you won't be able to login successfully.

The current salt paradigm (which only exists in CustomerService and AdminUserService) should be refactored to utilize Spring's SaltSource.
issues.title: Password salting does not work with a property on customer or AdminUser

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #441 - Provide a salting mechanism that works with a property on AdminUser or Customer

issues.body:
Tested by deploying to Tomcat 7.0.26. Startup warning is:

``` console
validateJarFile(/var/lib/tomcat7/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/lib/jsp-api-2.1.jar) - jar not loaded. See Servlet Spec 2.3, section 9.7.2. Offending class: javax/el/Expression.class
```

While it doesn't prevent startup, there shouldn't be a reason the Broadleaf brings in the JSP api jar. The dependency hierarchy is:

broadleaf-framework
----> solr-core 4.4
---------> hadoop-common 2.0.5
--------------> jsp-api 2.1
---------> hadoop-hdfs 2.0.5
--------------> jsp-api 2.1

Recommend adding exclusion for jsp-api in the broadleaf-framework pom when bringing in the solr-core dependency.
issues.title: Remove jsp-api Dependency from Compile Phase

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Resolves #439 - Exclude jsp-api from being brought in by Solr core

issues.body:
Error case for reproducing this:

With pricelist module enabled and a customer that has a pricelist, if you log in as that customer and recover a previously saved cart, when it reprices through the MergeCart activity, you don't have the necessary things on the requestcontext to apply your specific pricing.
issues.title: Move mergeCart processing into CartStateFilter

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Moved MergeCart logic into CartStateFilter (was in AuthenticationSuccessHandler).   Fixes #429.
Also addresses #612 by allowing translations of cart items instead of deleting the cart.

Fixes #620 and finalizes #429 - Remove outdated merge cart service invocations by deprecating the merge cart processor as it has now been moved to the cart state processor. Also, remove any anonymous customer session attributes after their cart has been merged

(cherry picked from commit 1a6d6be66f52087fa0cf544aa5aa8416da867475)

Fixes #620 and finalizes #429 - Remove outdated merge cart service invocations by deprecating the merge cart processor as it has now been moved to the cart state processor. Also, remove any anonymous customer session attributes after their cart has been merged

issues.title: Authorize.Net module completes checkout workflow even when error URL is received from Authorize.Net
issues.body:
I am currently making a 3.1 DemoSite patch for the Authorize.Net module and I noticed that even when an error URL is returned from Authorize.Net the checkout workflow will complete.

After discussing possible solutions with @phillipuniverse and @elbertbautista I need to speak with @jefffischer or @bpolster to proceed.

If an offer is created and the targetItemCriteria is not set, there will be additional instances of OfferItemCriteria created for the offer every time it is modified. This behavior will continue until a rule is created for targetItemCriteria

issues.title: Error at Parent Category mapping with a category- Unhandled error processing ajax request

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #415 - Error at Parent Category mapping with a category- Unhandled error processing ajax request

Merge pull request #415 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-1723-paging-enhancement

Product paging query performance degrades during solr indexing

issues.body:
Catalogs with large quantities of categories suffer performance problems and exceptions (see #319) when accessing the category page in the admin. This page should be refactored to not call this API. Furthermore, this page should be refactored to load nodes in a "paged" scenario, rather than all at once for performance and resource considerations.

In lieu of these changes, we should consider removing this page until the performance aspects are addressed.
issues.title: Call to CategoryImpl.getChildCategoryXrefs() from categoryTree.html is inefficient for large catalogs

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #413 - Disable the category tree until a more performant solution is implemented

issues.body:
I found there may be an issue in [this line](https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce/blob/master/core/broadleaf-framework-web/src/main/java/org/broadleafcommerce/core/web/api/wrapper/FulfillmentGroupWrapper.java#L164)

Is it supposed to get the 'blOrderService' bean instead?
issues.title: No bean named 'blCartService' is defined

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Resolves #412 - Fix an incorrect service reference to blCartService in FulfillmentGroupWrapper

issues.body:
The YUI compressor can potentially fail, which will prevent the entire bundle from being loaded.

We should serve a non-minified file and log a warning in this scenario instead of blowing up.
issues.title: JavaScript minifier can potentially throw unrecoverable exception

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #410 - JavaScript minifier can potentially throw unrecoverable exception

issues.body:
For example, if you put 
<div class="test"><img src="/cmsstatic/images/test.jpg"></img><br></br></div>, it is saved correctly in the db. But when you go back in the Admin, the "</img>" and "</br>" are not shown in the HTML Content box. And when you click save, those closing tags are not being saved, resulting in error when rendering the content.
issues.title: Closing tags getting deleted in structured content management

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Merge pull request #409 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-1711-enhance-product-cph

Viewing the product list page in the admin can be slow for large catalogs

issues.body:
To reproduce:
1. Create a custom field and expose to rule builders
2. Create a offer rule using the custom field on the offer page
3. Delete the custom field
4. Return to the offer page

You should see the error code on the rule displaying the raw mvel. We are correct in not allowing the user to update the raw mvel, as this would be a security hole. However, there should be a button or something to clear the rule value and set it back to its default state. Currently, to correct the issue, you would have to delete the offer criteria manually from the DB.
issues.title: If a rule fails parsing for some reason, provide a way to clear out the rule in the admin

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixes #407 - Provide better UX when an MVEL rule cannot be parsed in the admin

issues.body:
For example: 
Assuming there is more than than 50 products.
When attempting to add a product to a category by clicking the Add button above the 'All Products' collection grid ( from a url like _/admin/category/1_). This brings up the 'Add All Products' modal.  From here click the Filter and Sort arrow and then 'Sort A-Z'  which makes the following request 

_/admin/category/1/allProductXrefs/add?sortProperty=defaultSku.name&sortDirection=ASCENDING_

Then scroll down enough to trigger the ajax load of the rest of the products, which will drop the sort parameters and makes the following request:
_/admin/category/1/allProductXrefs/add?startIndex=50&maxIndex=92_

This causes the wrong records to be loaded because the query is no longer sorted.
it should make a call like this:
_/admin/category/1/allProductXrefs/add?sortProperty=defaultSku.name&sortDirection=ASCENDING&startIndex=50&maxIndex=92_

Of course this is just an example and appears to apply to every sortable listgrid in a model window in the admin.

issues.body:
1. Create admin user with dummy data everywhere
2. Do not assign any roles/permissions to that user
3. Logout with the original admin user
4. Login with the newly-created test admin user

Result is a constant 403 error page:
![screen shot 2013-09-11 at 10 58 29 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/684275/1124241/093e570c-1afb-11e3-9236-607837e6cb94.png)

You can not get past this at all without clearing out your cookies or waiting until the session expires.

Possible fix would be to prevent the user from logging in in the first place. If they have no roles to access anything, logging in should be invalid.
issues.title: If an admin user is created by another admin user without associating the default role, cookie clearing is required

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Cherry pick change from develop to add default permissions for admin access after successful login.

Addresses #355 and #614.

Notes:
- Fixed issue with salt not being applied during add (if the salt was on the id field).
- Fixed issue with salt being applied twice in some cases.
- Password is not required but if left blank on add it will generate a random password.   If using a salt, no user will be able to login with this password.
- If password is left blank on the update admin then the password field will be ignored.

issues.body:
Multiple saves happen at the same time:
1. Save the main entity
2. Save the dynamic forms

Both of these operations should be wrapped in a single transaction together. If saving 1 of them fails, the entire transaction should fail.

Validation errors on either the entity or any of the dynamic forms should also trigger a transaction rollback as qualitatively you should not be saving 'part of a form' (which is how it appears in the admin).

Reproducible by:
1. Edit structured content
2. Remove the Content Name field (which is a required field)
3. Make an edit to any of the dynamic fields

You will then see that there is a validation error on the content name (because it's blank) but the changed value in the dynamic form will also have been persisted. Similar things happen in the opposite direction (validation exception on a dynamic form, main entity property is persisted).
issues.title: Saving an entity form that contains a dynamic forms lead to partial saves

issues.body:
Since #194, a DB constraint has been added from Payment Response Item back to PaymentInfo via the reference number. This assumes that the Payment Info reference number is a unique String.

The default implementation of CreditCardPaymentInfoFactoryImpl set this to be the Order ID, however in the case of multiple payments on one order, you will get a "Unique Constraint Violation" in the BLC_ORDER_PAYMENTS table.

On creation of PaymentInfo in CreditCardPaymentInfoFactoryImpl, change the reference number to be unique.
issues.title: CreditCardPaymentInfoFactoryImpl should create a unique Reference Number

issues.body: The IdGenerationService will create a new row in BLC_ID_GENERATION when a new id is requested for an idType that does not already exist. In this case, the combination of the new row and the new id causes the first batch of ids to be repeated. This has not bit us yet because the general practice is to pre-seed the table with the idType, which is the case with Customer ids, which has been the only prominent use case so far.

issues.body:
applicationContext-servlet-cms-contentClient.xml defines the following component scan:

``` xml
    <context:component-scan base-package="org.broadleafcommerce.cms">
        <context:exclude-filter type="regex" expression="org.broadleafcommerce.cms.admin.*"/>
    </context:component-scan>
```

Since the intention of this file is to go into the servlet's contextConfigLocation, that component-scan is executed and any overrides that someone has made to the CMS beans in the recommended way (which is make them within an applicationContext that is referenced in patchConfigLocations) are done away with.

For example, say that I have this in applicationContext.xml within site (which is declared via patchConfigLocations and is picked up in the root Spring context):

``` xml
<bean id="blStructuredContentService" class="com.mycompany.site.cms.service.StructuredContentService" />
```

If I then inject blStructuredContentService anywhere, the bean will still be of type org.broadleafcommerce.cms.structure.service.StructuredContentServiceImpl.
issues.title: CMS beans are overridden based on current servlet configurations

issues.body:
The relevant part of the stack trace looks like this:

``` console
 [startAnt] Caused by: org.hibernate.HibernateException: Could not locate table which owns column [FULFILLMENT_GROUP_ID] referenced in order-by mapping
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.entity.JoinedSubclassEntityPersister.determineTableNumberForColumn(JoinedSubclassEntityPersister.java:854)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.entity.AbstractEntityPersister.getTableAliasForColumn(AbstractEntityPersister.java:4931)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.collection.AbstractCollectionPersister$StandardOrderByAliasResolver.resolveTableAlias(AbstractCollectionPersister.java:1935)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.sql.ordering.antlr.OrderByFragmentTranslator$StandardOrderByTranslationImpl.injectAliases(OrderByFragmentTranslator.java:106)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.collection.AbstractCollectionPersister.getSQLOrderByString(AbstractCollectionPersister.java:751)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.OneToManyJoinWalker.initStatementString(OneToManyJoinWalker.java:126)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.OneToManyJoinWalker.<init>(OneToManyJoinWalker.java:84)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.OneToManyLoader.<init>(OneToManyLoader.java:71)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.OneToManyLoader.<init>(OneToManyLoader.java:60)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.OneToManyLoader.<init>(OneToManyLoader.java:52)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.loader.collection.BatchingCollectionInitializer.createBatchingOneToManyInitializer(BatchingCollectionInitializer.java:103)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.collection.OneToManyPersister.createCollectionInitializer(OneToManyPersister.java:362)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.persister.collection.AbstractCollectionPersister.postInstantiate(AbstractCollectionPersister.java:662)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.internal.SessionFactoryImpl.<init>(SessionFactoryImpl.java:466)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration.buildSessionFactory(Configuration.java:1743)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.ejb.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.<init>(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:94)
 [startAnt]     at org.hibernate.ejb.Ejb3Configuration.buildEntityManagerFactory(Ejb3Configuration.java:905)
 [startAnt]     ... 33 more
```

This is because of [a bug in Hibernate](https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-7630) that exists starting in version 4.1.5.FINAL. The bug is triggered because of the following code in OrderImpl:

``` java
    @OneToMany(mappedBy = "order", targetEntity = FulfillmentGroupImpl.class, cascade = {CascadeType.ALL})
    @Cache(usage = CacheConcurrencyStrategy.NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE, region="blOrderElements")
    @OrderBy("id")
    @AdminPresentationCollection(friendlyName="OrderImpl_Fulfillment_Groups",
                tab = Presentation.Tab.Name.FulfillmentGroups, tabOrder = Presentation.Tab.Order.FulfillmentGroups)
    protected List<FulfillmentGroup> fulfillmentGroups = new ArrayList<FulfillmentGroup>();\
```

Note the `@OrderBy("id")` annotation on that collection of FulfillmentGroups. According to the Hibernate bug, the 'id' column is not added to the list of available columns to be ordered by. Since this is actually the default behavior of Hibernate collections (they are sorted by id without any annotation) then this should be safe to remove.
issues.title: Hibernate startup issue if FulfillmentGroup is extended

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Remove unnecessary OrderBy annotation to resolve Hibernate issue. Fixes #205

issues.body:
This is an edge case that requires several conditions to be met. This could potentially be attributed as an invalid state to begin with, but I wanted to make a record of this somewhere.

1) Have an extension of a Broadleaf entity like `Product` --> `MyProduct`

2) Register `MyProduct` as the default implementation of `Product`

3) Have a record that is a Product but NOT a MyProduct

4) Attempt to add a cross sale product from any product to the one mentioned in step 3

5) `FieldManager:200` (shown below) will attempt to find a `MyProduct` with an id that doesn't make sense, as it's only a Product record

``` java
Object newEntity = entityConfiguration.createEntityInstance(field.getType().getName());
```

@jefffischer : is it valid to define a default type for a Broadleaf entity and then still have ones that are only of the super type? If so, this isn't a bug and this ticket can be closed.
issues.title: Creating relationships with polymorphic hierarchies can fail

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#186 - Rework how polymorphic filtering works.
Unfortunately, simply identifying the correct path is not sufficient
for Hibernate to generate well-formed queries. This commit reworks
that strategy to ensure that the proper roots and restrictions are
defined in these cases.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/BroadleafCommerce-3.0.x' into develop

# By Andre Azzolini (11) and Kelly Tisdell (1)
# Via Andre Azzolini
* origin/BroadleafCommerce-3.0.x:
  #201 - GeneratedResource isn't serializable
  #186 - Allow sorting on polymorphic fields as well as filtering
  #197 - MapStructurePersistenceModule is not polymorphic entity friendly
  #178 - Fix sorting
  #194 - Correctly render PaymentResponseItem amount as Money
  #194 - Render PaymentResponseItems in the admin tool
  #185 - Update antisamy definitions to allow links that open in "_blank"
  #178 - The basic field persistence provider can't handle extraction of enums

  #186 - Rework how polymorphic filtering works. Unfortunately, simply identifying the correct path is not sufficient for Hibernate to generate well-formed queries. This commit reworks that strategy to ensure that the proper roots and restrictions are defined in these cases.

  #186 - Additional bug when a polymorphic type is defined as the root
#186 - Fix slight bug where exceptions get thrown when they shouldn't

@jefffischer 
If I have two entities, TaxModuleConfiguration and AddressVerificationModuleConfiguration, that extend from AbstractModuleConfiguration, if they each have the same property name (e.g. accountNumber), only one of them will be assigned a form field for it. This seems to be related to FormBuilderServiceImpl.removeNonApplicableFields(...).  The getAvailableToTypes method only seems to be returning a value for one of the two siblings.  The easy answer is to change the names of the properties in the sibling classes.  But that's not likely the best solution in the long run. Thoughts?

issues.body:
Originally reported at BroadleafCommerce/DemoSite#11 by @dcuchetti

Hi All,

I have found a critical bug during the merge cart process on the demo site (BLC 2.2.1-SNAPSHOT and BLC 3.0.0, i have not tested on other version)

1/ Register a new customer
2/ Add a product in cart
3/ logout
4/ add a new product in cart
5/ login with the customer created previously
6/ THE PRODUCT CONTAINED IN THE CART IS NOT THE LAST PRODUCT ADDED IN CART

Other example :

1/ Register a new customer
2/ Add a product in cart
3/ Remove the product from cart
3/ logout
4/ add a new product in cart
5/ login with the customer created previously
6/ THE CART IS EMPTY when it should contain the last product added in cart

However, the order contained into the mergeCartResponse is correct, what is weird...

7/ After checkout the current cart, the cart contains the previous cart merged   

Please let me know if you need more infos.

issues.body:
@jefffischer @apazzolini 

I am having an issue now with the admin, when trying to create polymorphic entities.  Here's the scenario:

ModuleConfiguration is the ceiling entity.  AbstractModuleConfiguration is an abstract base class that implements ModuleConfiguration.  Since it is abstract it must be excluded from polymorphism (i.e. it should not be directly instantiated through the admin).  There is code to filter out excluded classes, and it seems to work nicely.  However, it seems that if there are sibling children of the excluded parent, then one of them is chosen as the new trunk of the ClassTree, and the other is never added to the tree (since it is not a child of the trunk, rather it's a sibling).  So, here's the example:

TaxModuleConfiguration extends AbstractModuleConfiguration
AddressVerificationModuleConfiguration extends AbstractModuleConfiguration
AbstractModuleConfiguration is excluded from polymorphism in the admin (because it's abstract)
Therefore, only TaxModuleConfiguration is presented by the admin.  AddressVerificationModuleConfiguration is ignored since it is not a child of TaxModuleConfiguration.

Thoughts on the best way to fix this?
issues.title: Excluded polymorphic entities cause problems in the admin if they are the root of the ClassTree

issues.body:
Given the pattern where our activities are responsible for registering their own RollbackState and each activity manages its own transaction. You can run into the scenario where activity N+1 persists something which depends on something that was persisted in activity N (e.g. constraint on the DB). Since the rollback states are registered by the activity in the order which they are run, the rollback states should be run in the reverse order as to avoid any db constraint issues.

Possible solutions:
Either reverse the list before calling rollbackState() or implement the StateContainer list as a Stack
issues.title: ActivityStateManagerImpl should rollback the registered states in the reverse order they were added.

Fixes #101 - Utilize a stack for the internal rollback state containers. That way, activities can be rolled back in the reverse order that they were executed in the workflow. This fixes scenarios where downstream activities depend on data from upstream activities.

issues.title: Price adjustments set on a product option do not apply if there is no price set for a non-default sku
issues.body:
Scenario:
ProductOption A is set up with 2 possible values. The first one has no price modification and the second value has +$50.00 as its adjustment.
Product B has defaultSku with price $100.
Product B also has 2 generated skus, neither of which has a price set.
In this case, adding the sku with the price modifier to cart will result in the price being $100, not $150.
This is fixed in 2.3, the change just needs to be backported.

Originally reported by @apazzolini

``` console
[java] ERROR (Ejb3Configuration.java:843) - Container is providing a null PersistenceUnitRootUrl: discovery impossible
```

This is seen in the logs during startup of tomcat. Does not seem to affect the project when orm locations are manually defined, but it they were to be scanned off of classpath, it could be a problem.
It looks like the PersistenceUnitInfo coming out of the MergePersistenceUnitManager needs to set the PersistenceUnitInfo.persistenceRootUrl to the classpath of the merging PU.
issues.title: Null PersistenceUnitRootUrl during Ejb configuration error

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
issue #58
Incorporate PaymentGatewayTransactionService implementation to the null payment gateway.
To simulate the failure increment and threshold functionality that should exist in payment gateway implementations (via AbstractExternalPaymentGatewayCall), we create an interface that exposes the 3 methods relevant to this task
Broadleafcommerce/Subscriptions issue #58 - expose also the failure threshhold, in order not to rely on an arbitrary number of failures for bringing the service down

Fixes #58 - Do not explicitly add the persistenceUnitRootURL of a PersistenceUnit to null and add the URL to that persistence unit’s jar files. Hibernates Ejb3Configuration scans both locations automatically anyway, and if the persistence unit root URL is null then Hibernate logs a message at the error level. Also, URLs can only be scanned once. They should not occur in both the list of jars for that persistence unit AND as the root URL
